{BLOK000} Council Building, Seat of the Sebainah {BLOK001} City Gate {BLOK002} House of the South Wind Clan {BLOK003} Dji-Kas Guild (Magicians) and Healer {BLOK004} Dji-Fadh Guild (Formers) {BLOK005} Tavern "House of the Winds"{BLOK006} Weapon Smith {BLOK007} Food Shop {BLOK008} Mixed Goods {BLOK009} Battle Trainer
{CNTR} On the shield it says: ^ ^ {INK 006} Jirinaar Council House
{INK 001} The young Iskai is not used to the look of human beings. He begins to giggle uncontrollably and can't get a word out.
"Dsarii-ma! I have to tell my sister I've met you! She will be so jealous!"
"Dsarii-ma, Guests of the City. Behave peacefully and friendly and you will have no problems here."
"Dsarii-ma. Be careful in the harbor area. There are a lot of hotheads there."
"Dsarii-ma, Guests of the City. Enjoy your visit to our city!"
"Dsarii-ma, visitors! I hope you like the many charming views which our city has to offer."
"I do not wish to talk to you."
"Dsarii-ma. Isn't the size of the city fantastic? I live in the countryside and it never ceases to amaze me!"
"We'd better not tell him that many apartment complexes on Earth have more residents than all of Jirinaar..."
"Dsarii-ma. Don't get into trouble, we Stiriik cannot be everywhere."
{CNTR}The shield announces: ^ ^ {INK 006} Wanja, House of Useful Goods. ^ Enter from the 6th to the 19th hour.
{CNTR} On the shield it says: ^ ^ {INK 006} Snird House of Weapons. ^ Welcome from the 10th to the 20th hour.
{CNTR} On the shield one can read: ^ ^ {INK 006} Zirr & Viri's House of the Winds. ^ Public House.
{CNTR} The inscription says: ^ ^ {INK 006} Frinja, House of Good Food. ^ Open from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m.
{CNTR} On the shield it says: ^ ^ {INK 006} House of the South Wind Clan.
{CNTR} The following can be read on the shield: ^ ^ {INK 066} Guild House of the Dji-Kas.
{CNTR} The shield says: ^ ^ {INK 006} Guild House of the Dji-Fadh. ^ Guild Members' Entrance.
{CNTR} The inscription says: ^ ^ {INK 006} Guild House of the Dji-Fadh. ^ Public Entrance.
The door is latched and no one reacts to {LEAD}{NAME}'s knocking. The shop must be closed.
This door is locked.

{LEAD}{NAME} is addressed by one of the Iskai dressed in battle armor standing beside the city gate. ^ ^ {INK 002} "Dsarii-ma, Visitor of our City. I must ask you not to leave the city before you have spoken with Sebainah Janiis. ^ Moreover, the wilderness which surrounds Jirinaar is dangerous for strangers who are not familiar with the area."

"Dsarii-ma, visitors of our city. I must ask you not to leave the gate before you have spoken with Sebainah Janiis. ^ Moreover, the wilderness which surrounds Jirinaar is dangerous for strangers who are not familiar with the area."

"By the way, my valued colleagues, here is the main building of the Stiriik. Of course, only Stiriik can access the building so we won't be able to go sightseeing. But, just between us, we won't be missing a lot."
"Dsarii-ma! Don't forget to speak to Sebainah Janiis."

{INK 001} Tom and Rainer are addressed by an Iskai dressed in battle armor. ^ ^ {INK 002} "Dsarii-ma, visitors of our city. I have come just in time. I see you have recovered from your wounds. ^ ^ In the name of the Sebainah, the chief of the council, I would like to welcome you to Jirinaar. The Sebainah would like to have a discussion with you. ^ ^ She can be found in the council building, the building in the middle of the city. It is surrounded by the river and can't be missed because of its large size. The Sebainah is in the council building almost every hour of the day. You can visit her at any time. ^ ^ Of course, if you wish, I can take you to her immediately."
"Do you want me to take you to the Sebainah immediately?"
"Don't wait too long before you visit the Sebainah. Now, please excuse me."
"Dsarii-ma. I hope your conversation with the Sebainah was pleasant."
The Iskai makes his way to the council building. Tom and Rainer have trouble keeping up with his fast walk, but they soon reach the city's government building and enter.

"Congratulations on your extremely diplomatic action, Driscoll! Not only have you offended the people who have saved our lives, but I would also like to point out that we have no idea where the pieces of our shuttle are and how we can exchange them for the local currency."
The door to the Hunter Clan's house is secured with a lock.
{INVE}{NAME} opens the door with Wrinn's key.
"This magnificent house belongs to a rich merchant. He lives a very reclusive life. I doubt we can get in here."
"One of the councilors lives here. Nice little house, huh?"
A kind of fountain.
The door to the house of the Hunter Clan. It is secured with a lock.
A door.
{CNTR}{INK 003}{FAHI}YO! ^ ^ One hour passed!

{INK 001} A Stiriik comes up to Drirr and says breathlessly: ^ ^ {INK 002} "Dsarii-ma, Drirr! A cattle breeder just came into the city who says he saw the Kenget Kamulos murderer go into the ruins of the old Former center!"
"We should go to the old Former building as quickly as possible. Perhaps we can still catch the murderer!"
"Thank you, first we would like to look around the city a little."
"Dsarii-ma. Welcome to Jirinaar."
"Dsarii-ma and have a nice journey!"

"The old Former building, or the old Argim as some say, lies to the northeast of the city, I believe. ^ ^ I have never been there. ^ ^ Let's go there immediately... Perhaps we can catch the guy there!"
{CNTR} In small script it says here: ^ ^ {INK 006} The Art of Battle. 8 a.m. to 7 p.m.
empty
No member of the group is particularly eager to put their hand there.

This is a fairly large kettle. Perhaps it can store supplies, water, or food.
In the water basin, there's a strange plant which pumps water out of the ground with its strong, pulsating motions. Apparently, this fountain serves as the water supply.
The water in this pool smells bad and foul. This is probably where sewage is collected.
Water plants.
Herbaceous plants.

A staircase. It leads down through the floor.
A staircase goes up through the floor.
This is apparently some kind of bed. It is filled with sand, which offers astounding comfort because of its coarse but rounded grains.
The enormous shape makes this look like sitting furniture. It acts like a plant. It has apparently grown. The surface is soft and elastic.
The fountain of the house.
The water channels probably serve for the drinking water supply. They run through the house like small brooks.

The musty odor and the holes in the object lead to the conclusion that this is a kind of toilet. This "furniture" is also made from plants, and thrives vigorously because of its regular fertilization.
This is where the really urgent activities in life are performed.
A sweet, tart smelling dish is cooking in this pan.

This seat literally grows out of the ground and is quite comfortable.
A wooden pole. There is a sign on the top.
Place holder for further Cut-Map Events.
"I put all of the equipment that I still had with me in here."
"Before we leave the house, we should go by our room. I have stored the rest of our equipment in the big cabinet."
This trunk is open.
The spacious cabinet is unlocked.

"I've already seen parts of the house. The architecture is fantastic! Almost everything appears to consist of plants, heaven knows how they do it. And there is water almost everywhere. The people here bathe often and apparently they have no nudity taboo."
"No wonder with this heat."

"Pardon me for my enthusiasm, but look at the giant object over there. It is a kind of pump and functions without any mechanical parts. I believe the people who live here are very proud of their fountain."
"Tom and Rainer, I have just come from the Sebai. He wishes to speak with you. Would you please follow me?"
"Of course, we'll be glad to talk to him."
"Now we'll hopefully learn the reason why we were saved."
"Don't be ungrateful, Driscoll. But we probably should not talk with each other in our own language in the presence of this Sebai. It would probably be considered impolite."
"Tom and Rainer, the chief of the Clan of the South Wind Hunters, Sebai-li Wrinn, I will leave you alone now."
"He is still a CHILD, Driscoll! That can't be!"
"I see. May I remind you of your advice only to speak Iskai?"
{CNTR} The inscription of the shield says: ^ ^ {INK 006} Supply Chambers. ^ Children: Think of the consequences!
"Just smell those aromas, Driscoll! This must be the kitchen."
"This is where that hellishly hot stuff they fed us came from."
"I love spicy food. We can't say it hurt us."
"You didn't spend weeks with a bucket... well, let's change the subject."
"I've already figured out what this is. Believe it or not, it's a kind of plant toilet!"
"Hofstedt! ^ O.K. O.K. I will try to put it simply: ^ WHAT - HAPPENED?"

"Do you remember the crash landing and our getting out? Good. Shortly after the shuttle exploded like in a bad American television show. My first memory after that is being transported on a stretcher. When I saw who was helping me, I immediately passed out again. ^ Driscoll, these beings are INTELLIGENT!"
"I can see that this... house didn't grow out of the ground. Although, if you look at it more carefully..."
"You don't understand, there is intelligent life here. We've made contact with the third non-human race! Their culture is fantastic and..."

"Hofstedt, please! My head is spinning even without your attempts at explanation. Start from the beginning for goodness' sake. How could the instruments be so wrong? We set out with breathing masks expecting a Mars-like world, and end up in a damned jungle more dense than anything on Earth!"

"I have no idea what went wrong. You can feel most of the facts with your own body. We find ourselves on an oxygen-rich, warm world with an enormous variety of flora and fauna. The gravity, as expected, is a bit under 1 G. ^ ^ Up to now our immune system has handled the local microorganisms. The explosion got you more than me. You've been unconscious for almost 30 days. ^ ^ Stop! Don't even try it! You shouldn't try to stand for at least another 30 days!"
"I've noticed! Is anything else wrong with me?"
"I don't think so. Some broken bones, burns, and probably minor internal injuries. The head injury gave me the most concern, but you appear to be completely coherent. Your prosthesis is operational."
"Thank you. Continue."
"I was back on my feet quite quickly and have made contact with our hosts. Where shall I begin?"
"You're a scientist! Just stick to the facts."

"I will try my best. The people here call themselves Iskai. As you've seen, they are built like humans only taller and thinner. Also, they still have all their body fur. ^ ^ They appear to have descended from beasts of prey, as you can tell from the shape of their head. Otherwise, their history runs somewhat parallel to that of Homo Sapiens. ^ ^ The Iskai are mammals with two sexes just like us. Their technology isn't too advanced, yet they are quite capable of astounding architectural feats. ^ ^ The people that live here have taken good care of us and they've helped me keep you alive."
"Does that mean some kind of medicine man cured me?"

"No. On the other hand: Who knows? I was completely out of it our first day here. The only thing I can remember is that one of these fellows was in the room and fumbled around with us a bit. I don't think he was trying to impress us with some kind of hocus pocus. He was working with glittering plant seeds. I was too weak to protest against it, but apparently it didn't hurt us. Then I used three of our medipacs to get you to your current state."
"Drenis bat ardriiba na gendi?"
"Kriidak na grriina, ah, strokiri. Badri?"
"Frji wan drobia. Lanarii!"
"Well, I can see you haven't wasted your time. You've learned their language in just four weeks."
"I only know a couple of words. Except for the pronunciation, the dialect is astoundingly easy to learn. I'll give you a basic course during the next few days so that you can catch up."

"Do it slowly, Hofstedt. I'm still trying to absorb all this. This situation is... I mean... What we are experiencing here is unbelievable! In real life, things like this don't happen to normal people..."

"Heh, heh, be quiet, Driscoll! I'm sure anyone who has experienced something that only happens in movies would feel the same way. But this is really happening! Accept it, and you'll see that you'll be on your feet in no time. Then we must find a way to get back to the ship."
"The ship, right. I'd be really surprised if it is still in orbit."

"I think it will land at the predetermined point. From there, we can build a research station instead of a mining structure. That way your company can at least make some money on the exclusive rights to the first documentary."
"We must find out where we are and how we can get to the landing point. Since our shuttle has been destroyed beyond repair, the trip to the Toronto could take a long time."
"That's right. But, first we have to learn to communicate. Sleep for a while, and then we'll begin the first lesson."
"O.K. And, Hofstedt..."
"Yes?"
"Thank you for everything."

"These Iskai are a xenobiologist's dream! One moment, their similarity to human beings is frightening; and then the next, they are so alien. Just imagine the consequence of this Sebai ritual! Despite their short life span, the Iskai have quasi-immortality! ^ ^ What has also amazed me is that this world, so rich in raw materials, values the metal from our shuttle so much."

"Dsarii-ma, guests of the house. If you intend to go hunting in the forests, you must first talk with Krinn, the Stri of the Hunt. He can give you good advice. You will recognize him by his gray-brown fur coat with gray stripes."
{INK 001} The Iskai child looks with big eyes at the people in front of him. The sight has apparently left him dumbfounded.
"Dsarii-ma! I hope you've enjoyed the hospitality of the South Wind Clan and feel welcome with us."
"Dsarii-ma. You look really funny. Are you sick, or is something wrong with your fur?"
"Dsarii-ma. Excuse me, I can only talk for a short time. I must prepare for the next hunt."
"Dsarii-ma! You're no bigger than I am!"
"Dsarii-ma. I am one of the people who found you. I will never forget that explosion as long as I live!"
This door leads outside.
This door has a good lock.
{LEAD}{NAME} opens the lock with Wrinn's key.
There is something interesting in this chest!
The chest is locked.
{LEAD}{NAME} opens the chest with a skeleton key.
This spacious cabinet has a lot of storage space.
Several weeks later: Tom has recovered, and has learned the basics of the Iskai language with Rainer's help. Today, for the first time, he feels strong enough to get out of bed.
{FAHI}--SCRIPT SEQUENCE--{NORS} ^ ^ Picture: Tom wakes up and sees "his nurse" who surprises him with her, to put it mildly, non-human face. ^ ^ Rainer comes in and begins to explain the situation.
"Never, Hofstedt! And even if Giria eats me, I won't stay in this sandbox a day longer!"
"Your nurse surely won't be happy about that. But, please, take it easy - it looks as if you will be walking again shortly."
"I'm doing O.K., aren't I? It's time to finally leave this room."
"O.K. ^ But YOU talk to Giria!"
"Tom! What are you doing up! Haven't I told you to save your strength? Now, it's not MY fault if you collapse! I'll tell Sebai-li Wrinn that you seem to have regained your strength."
"Phew! I thought it would be worse! Hasn't she told us about this Sebai-whatever before?"
"Yes. I think he is the head of this family. He must be very old if I understand her correctly."
"That doesn't mean much compared to us. The Iskai apparently only get to be about 30 to 40 years old."

"No wonder they are so frantic. They always seem to be running a top speed. Just look at Giria now. I wanted to thank her for her care, to calm her down, but she's already disappeared. ^ ^ Never mind, let's take a look around the house."
This door leads out into the city. It is secured with a lock.
{INVE}{NAME} unlocks the door with Wrinn's key.
empty
In the cellar it's a little cooler than upstairs.
"Dsarii-ma. Ah, I could sleep all day. Hopefully I haven't caught any diseases."
"I have to go back to bed, and I'm not even tired!"
"The Iskai children are more similar to their human counterparts than one would believe."
"Dsarii-ma, you wide people!"
The person {INK 001}{LEAD}{NAME} mumbles: {INK 002} ^ ^ "Dsarii-ma. I hv a swlln jaw. I cn't tlk."
Test
empty
"Dsarii-ma, visitor of the council."
"Dsarii-ma. I'm only an overworked scribe. Please excuse me, valued guests."
"Dsarii-ma. I am part of the council group for river management. I don't believe that we have anything to talk about."
"Dsarii-ma. Excuse me, the Sebainah has ordered me to do something that can't wait."
"Dsarii-ma. If you, like all the other strangers, wish to speak with Sebai-Giz Frill, you will find his work room in the east wing of the building. Of course, he's often away."

"I belong to the council committee for family matters. Sometimes it's difficult work, since arguments don't often win against emotions. But sorry, I'm talking so much. I'm sure you have much more important things to do."
"Dsarii-ma. I cannot help you much. I'm one of Vris' helpers and keep the building in good shape."
"Dsarii-ma. Look at the magnificent plants in the meeting room. I take care of them!"

{FAHI}-SCRIPT SEQUENCE--{NORS} ^ ^ Tom and Rainer run into the meeting hall, where the ceremony has suddenly been interrupted with Akiir's murder. The party receives the order to solve the murder. Information about the murder is now provided. Drirr joins the party! ^ ^ Then, it is reported that the fugitive murderer was seen in the vicinity of the Dji-Kas guild house. Everyone heads there...
First-aid is given to the groggy Tom upon his arrival at the council building.
First-aid is given to the groggy Rainer upon his arrival at the council building...
Bradir maintains a calm composure when the Sebainah speaks to him.
"Bradir, please explain to us your unusual reaction when you saw the antique weapon the murderer had with him."
"Sebainah, the dagger was part of the murderer's payment. It belonged to me. Upon seeing it, I lost my nerve. ^ ^ I am really happy it is all over now."
"You're saying that YOU gave the order? YOU had Akiir, your admired friend, murdered?"
"No, by the Goddess! I did not hire the murderer!"
"But you know the person who gave the order?"
"Yes, Sebainah. ^ ^ It was ... Akiir himself."
{CNTR} "WHAT?"
{CNTR} "IMPOSSIBLE!"
{CNTR} "That cannot be!"
"I know that Bradir was the closest and most honest friend that my father ever had. Let him continue."

"Akiir knew for almost a year that he had an incurable disease. He had, at most, six months to live. Then, when he learned of Sira's decision to transfer to the guild of the Dji-Kas, he drastically changed and became more and more unpredictable. ^ ^ A while ago, he came to me with a plan for his staged murder. In addition to getting revenge on Fasiir he wanted to make Sira leave the guild of the Dji-Kas again. For days I tried to talk him out of his plan, but he would not change his mind. He appealed to me, on my honor as a friend, to fulfill his last wish. There was nothing else I could do! ^ ^ He bribed the Dji-Kas Kriis with an absurd sum and entrusted an assassin from the Kenget Kamulos human tribe with the murder. To get rid of the murderer we arranged to meet at the guild's old center after the deed was done. We hoped that the predators there would take care of the witnesses. The last few weeks have been the worst in my life. I will gladly subject myself to testing by a Tri-Nadh to verify my story."
There is a long pause while all of the listeners try to digest the story. ^ ^ Sira, Akiir's daughter, is the first to speak:

"Bradir has been a friend of my family since my childhood. In my opinion, he could not have made all of this up. I loved my father, but I know how obstinate he could be. Under these extreme conditions... ^ ^ He really could have reacted this way. And that because of ME, oh, Goddess. ^ ^ I believe Bradir's words."

"I also believe Bradir. He is free of suspicion. ^ ^ Return to your guild, Bradir. You have a lot of explaining to do there. ^ ^ Fasiir, who has been wrongly accused, will be rehabilitated immediately. ^ ^ Kriis, the bribed Dji-Kas, will have to answer for his treason."
"Does this clear us of our duty to solve the murder, Sebainah Janiis?"
"Yes, it does. I thank you humans, and also you, Drirr, for clearing up this matter. Nothing more stands in the way of your journey."
"We were a good team. Tom and Rainer, if you want, I will accompany you on the journey. I could do with a little excitement."
"Gladly, Drirr! I'm happy to have you with us."

"Tom and Rainer, I've always made impulsive decisions. ^ ^ I would also like to join you for a while. After what has happened here, I would like to get away from everything. ^ ^ A trip will do me good, and my modest magical talents can certainly be useful to you. What do you say?"
"Naturally you are welcome, Sira! We probably have a long journey ahead of us and the more who join us, the better!"

"Although Akiir's tragic plan has left a feeling of sadness, I am glad that everything is finally cleared up. ^ ^ Tom and Rainer, you are still welcome guests here in Jirinaar. When you are ready to begin your journey, speak to me. I now declare the meeting ended."
Tom, Rainer, Drirr, and Sira leave the Sebainah's room.
Tom and Rainer enter the council building right on time. ^ ^ In the meeting room, Tom and Rainer find a small group of Iskai. ^ ^ The Sebainah greets them:
"Dsarii-ma, Tom and Rainer, welcome to our meeting. May I introduce you to Akiir: he is the head of the guild of the Formers, or the Dji-Fadh, as we say."
"Dsarii-ma."
"And this is council member..."
The Sebainah is interrupted suddenly when a masked figure storms into the room. Shocked, Tom and Rainer recognize that it is a human being!
Before anyone can react, the human shoots a small arrow. Akiir collapses!
"Stiriik! Seize the human!"
"Akiir is dead. May he live with the Goddess."
"The murderer has fled through a window, Sebainah! We will search the city!"

"We must act swiftly. Send for Drirr, the Stiriik for Human Affairs! ^ ^ Honored council members, Briid, my nephew: Please go now. I am sorry that the ceremony has had such a tragic outcome. ^ ^ Tom and Rainer, I must speak with you."
"Dsarii-ma, Sebainah Janiis.
"Dsarii-ma, Drirr. Have you been informed of Akiir's murder?"
"Yes. What a shock!"
"Indeed! Drirr, I'm sure you've heard of Tom and Rainer, our visitors. They are strangers here and they need your help to solve this crime."
"I will stand beside them with everything I have, Sebainah. ^ ^ Tom and Rainer, I am sorry we have to meet under such circumstances."
"Dsarii-ma, Drirr. We are a little overcome by what has happened."

"I believe what you're saying. We should probably talk with Sebai-Giz Frill first. He can certainly tell us something about the murderer's human tribe. Let's go to his room. I am sure he knows about all this."
"Drirr! The murderer has been seen in the vicinity of the guild house of the Dji-Kas Magicians!"
"A trail! Let's immediately go to the Dji-Kas!"
All of them hurry to the guild house of the Magicians.
"This door leads to the room of the chief of the city, Sebainah Janiis. I will leave you now."

"Tom and Rainer, this is a difficult time. Some will assume that you had something to do with the murder for the simple fact that you are humans. I do not know your race well, but I believe you are just as shocked by all this as I am."
"Janiis, no one ever told us that there are native HUMANS on this planet! We are just trying to get over the shock!"
"You didn't know that? But I thought... You must have misunderstood our first conversation. You would have gotten to know your fellow humans on the island that we were going to take you to."
"You speak as if your offer can no longer be kept after what has happened."

"So it is. Unfortunately, I must inform you of our people's laws relevant to this type of crime. In order to compensate for the often undisciplined nature of many Iskai, there is the Law of Family Responsibility. Thus, to discourage transgressions, the entire family of a criminal is responsible for his behavior. If the Stiriik cannot immediately capture the evil-doer, the family is obligated to find their rebellious member or solve the crime. Of course, in this case they are supported and monitored by at least one Stiriik. ^ ^ Since you are the only humans in Jirinaar, you take the place of the family. You are now obligated to solve this murder and find the guilty parties. Only then can I permit you to continue your journey."
"But we are still strangers on this world. How can we possibly find those guilty of this crime?"
"I have already had a capable Stiriik sent for. He will help you with your task."
"It looks as if we have no other choice, right?"
"Unfortunately, no. I cannot overrule the laws. I can only wish you good luck in the hunt for the fugitive murderer and whoever gave him his orders."
"You're sure this was ordered by someone?"

"Without a doubt. The murderer belongs to a human race who are famous for their assassinations. These people seldom kill for their own interests. You should talk with Frill; I've heard he's in the palace again. Surely, he is on his way here. ^ ^ Ah, here comes Drirr, the Stiriik who will accompany you."
{CNTR}{INK 001} On the shield it says: ^ ^ {INK 006} ^ ^ Workroom of Sebai-Giz Frill {INK 006}
{CNTR}{INK 001} On the shield it says: ^ ^ {INK 006} ^ ^ Workroom of the Sebainah Janiis, chief of Jirinaar

Drirr joins up with Tom and Rainer. ^ ^ Together they go to the workroom of the scholar, Frill, who has just returned from a long trip. ^ ^ Drirr says Frill is the oldest Iskai of Nakiridaani and has a great deal of wisdom.
"Hopefully, the Stiriik of the City Watch will spot the murderer soon. ^ ^ Perhaps we should also search the city streets."
They all hurry to the guild house of the Magicians of Jirinaar, the Dji-Kas. ^ ^ The murderer can't be found on the street and so they enter the house...
"This Sebainah appears to be the chief here. I am anxious to see what she wants of us."

Bradir is quickly transported to the healer. ^ ^ As soon as he is treated, there is a gathering in the council building in the room of the Sebainah, where Bradir must explain his actions. ^ ^ In addition to Tom, Rainer, and Drirr, Sira, the daughter of the murdered Akiir, has also been summoned.
empty
{CNTR} The inscription says: ^ ^ {INK 006} Room of the Stri Dji-Kas
{CNTR} On the shield it says: ^ ^ {INK 006} Room of the Dra Dji-Kas
The tree looks very strange; its roots lie on the stone floor. Nevertheless, it appears to be very healthy. What's keeping it alive is unknown.
"Dsarii-ma. No matter what else is going on, I have to concentrate on my studies. The other Dra think I am crazy, but magic is more important to me than their petty business."
"Dsarii-ma. Please look for someone else to talk to, I have to think."
{INK 001} The person they speak to does not react. He appears to be thinking deeply.
"Dsarii-ma, visitors of our guild. Excuse me, I still have a lot to do."
"Darn it! Another experiment failed! Krrrrsss! You better find someone who is in a better mood to talk to!"

{INK 001} The person they speak to acts very absent-minded. With a glance toward Tom, he says: ^ ^ {INK 002} "Say, human, do you also have times when you can't think of anything but one certain woman? Ah, it doesn't matter..."
"Dsarii-ma, Dsarii-ma. I'm looking for my test data again. These young Dra have nothing but nonsense in their heads. Anyhow, they always manage to... Excuse me."

{FAHI}--SCRIPT SEQUENCE--{NORS} ^ ^ The fugitive murderer has been seen in this house, the bribed Dji-Kas Kriis says that he never gave the order for the murder. Sira is frightened and has disappeared.
When {LEAD}{NAME} attempts to examine the contents of the chest, the warehouseman notices and says:
"Honored Guests, this is not a store or market! ^ ^ I must ask you to leave our possessions alone!"
A stone area is embedded in the moss floor.
Fasiir leads his visitors into a room with a stone area in the moss floor.
"The most beautiful part of magic is that it can create things, even if it is only everyday objects. ^ ^ See here!"
"Driscoll, I... Did you see that? That is... I mean... ^ ^ I'm going crazy! The tree is real! That was no trick!"
"That is really something! These guys are no fakes, that's for sure. That was beyond any growth accelerators."
"A kingdom for a couple of measuring instruments! They cannot poke fun at the laws of physics!"

"I see, admittedly with satisfaction, that I was able to eliminate your doubts. I hope you now think a little bit differently of our talents. ^ ^ It was an honor for me to speak with you, {LEAD}{NAME}. Look around our place some more if you'd like, but for now I must return to my work."
"In any case, thank you very much for the impressive demonstration of your abilities, Fasiir."
"Dsarii-ma, hunters of Akiir's murderers! ^ ^ Let me assure you, we had nothing to do with the murder of Akiir! Kriis, that traitor, has paid bribes which brings suspicion on Fasiir, our leader."
"Dsarii-ma. You are searching for Akiir's murderer, right? Find the truth and you will discover that Fasiir and our guild are innocent of the crime!"
"Dsarii-ma, Hunters of the Murderer. Unfortunately, I cannot tell you anything about the incident except that we would never commit such a crime. Kriis, that trader, lied!"

Tom and Rainer, as well as their new companion, Drirr, enter the guild house of the Dji-Kas Magicians. They are accompanied by two Stiriik, the local police. First they meet Sira, the daughter of the murdered Akiir, who has "defected" to the guild of the Dji-Kas.
"Have you heard about the death of your father, Sira?"
"Yes, I... never even got the chance to speak to him again. Oh, Goddess, it is... ^ ^ Do you know who's behind the murder?"
"I grieve with you, Sira. No, we still have no clue. However, they say that the fugitive murderer has been seen near this building."
Fasiir, the Head of the Dji-Kas Magicians, enters.
"Dsarii-ma. I have heard about Akiir's murder. What brings you to us?"
"The murderer was seen near your guild. May we look around a little?"
"Of course. We have nothing to hide. ^ ^ Come!"
Suddenly an Iskai and a human emerge in the corridor. ^ ^ {FAT } He is the fugitive murderer! {NORS} When the Iskai notices he has been seen, he throws a glowing seed!
When the blinding light passes, only the Iskai remains. The murderer has disappeared!
"I believe that the murderer has disappeared to the south! After him! Stiriik, take this accomplice!"
"Damn! He escaped through a window again."
Drirr turns to the Iskai who produced the blinding light.
"Well, who are you and why have you helped the murderer escape?"

{INK 001} Fasiir, the chief of the Dji-Kas, intrudes: ^ ^ {INK 002} "His name is Kriis, he is, WAS, a member of our guild. ^ ^ Kriis, you miserable skorrek, why did you let the murderer come into our building?"
"But Fasiir, you, yourself, gave me the order! And now you want to sacrifice me? That won't get you anywhere! You paid the murderer yourself!"
"WHAT? ^ ^ Are you out of your mind? Drirr, don't believe a word of it! I had nothing to do with this thing!"
"I know the reason for the hostility between you, Fasiir, and Akiir very well. You have a motive for the murder!"
"After all these years, would I choose this time to..."
"Stiriik, please take Kriis and Fasiir into custody until we have caught the murderer and have found out the truth."
"Drirr, I would like to leave. I cannot stay here any longer. I have to be alone and think everything over."
{INK 001} Drirr turns to Tom and Rainer: ^ ^ {INK 002} ^ ^ "We almost had the murderer! In any case, he's no longer in this house. Perhaps we can still catch him somewhere in the city."
All need some time before they can see anything after the blinding light.
"Good, Drirr, we'll go. Only one more thing: ^ What is the story between Fasiir and the murdered Akiir?"

"Well, to make a long story short, Akiir was once married to Fasiir's sister. On a hunting trip with Akiir, Fasiir's sister lost her life. Fasiir blamed Akiir for the death of his sister since Akiir insisted on the trip in spite of bad weather. That is the reason for their lasting enmity. ^ ^ Now, let us search the city."

"Dsarii-ma. We rarely see visitors here. You will find all the important Stri upstairs."

"Dsarii-ma, guests of the guild house. I hope you like our art and tell your distant homeland about it!"
"Dsarii-ma. I was accepted into the guild only recently. Isn't this a beautiful building?"
The door is latched.

"There is a tank here into which household waste water is dumped from pipes in the floor. The plants in the tank clean the water before it is returned to the river through an underground canal system."

"This is a toilet made from a giant plant. The plant processes the fecal material rapidly and almost without odor. You only have to watch that it doesn't grow too large because of the regular fertilization."
"This furniture is very popular in larger families. It is made of living plant material. ^ ^ The texture is soft and elastic and, if it is damaged, the damaged area grows back by itself."

"If you like, you can go look at the house's fountain. It is quite in demand in larger clan houses. You will find it in the south part of the building. Now I will leave you alone to explore our guild house."
"Thank you very much for guiding us, Aliis. Surely you understand that we cannot buy any of the works of your guild."

"Ha ha! Yes, I figured as much! ^ ^ In any case, perhaps you would like to speak with Akiir, our chief, or Bradir, his representative. You'll find them in the northern part of the building. Take care!"
After the battle, Bradir drops to his knees. The pain drives the confused look from his face and his eyes become clear.
"We must take him to the healer, quickly. Otherwise, we will never understand why he attacked us."

"Dsarii-ma. You know, four children are a blessing, but one day they will eat {FAT }me{NORS} if I'm not able provide any more food, hir hir!"

"Dsarii-ma, travelers. You're in the right place. Frinja is famous for her nonperishable traveling provisions."

The dark caverns are overgrown with all kinds of plants and look nothing like a building. Many aromas penetrate the passages. Noises and subtle movements indicate that all kinds of life forms have found a home here.
A strangely shaped bush.
As soon as {LEAD}{NAME} touches the plant, it begins to glow in all colors of the rainbow!
{LEAD}{NAME} touches a rainbow bush.
A strange odor hangs in the air.
"That is the scent of predators. We should be careful!"
A root-like object. It is mobile, but doesn't appear to be aggressive.
Glowing, moving, grasping arms project out from the floor here. It tries to catch whatever moves and put it into its mouth at the lower end.

"An interesting creature. Notice the strong luminosity of the grasping arms. It is hard to say whether we are looking at a specimen of this world's flora or it's fauna, but this life form does seem to be carnivorous."
"I take it, my dear Rainer, that what you have expressed with such astounding words is that we should probably avoid these clutching arms? Insightful advice, which I will follow gladly!"
As {LEAD}{NAME} approaches the grasping arms, they grasp {HIM } and pull them toward its mouth!
"It appears to me that the light of the grasping arms is no accident. I think the creature attracts its prey with it. Light seems to play a great role in the animal world down here."
"I have an idea. Perhaps we can avoid another painful encounter with this predatory creature if we throw away our torch. The creature may be reacting to the light."
Now, since there's no more light, the creature's grasping arms are motionless.
A large, mushroom-like growth.
An opening has appeared in the wall!
This is a rainbow bush. Oddly, it is glowing, even though it has not been touched.
"Look! Wherever we step the floor is beginning to glow! Fascinating!"
A giant maw filled with teeth yawns in the floor and dispenses a strong odor of decay.
"What a horrible thing! We should definitely go around it."
"There is a justification for every life form's existence, Driscoll. However, that doesn't mean we should sacrifice our lives just to extend its existence, so I'll go along with you on that."
"I've never seen anything like it. It looks pretty deadly alright."
{LEAD}{NAME} approaches the mouth and falls into the giant throat. The force of the closing jaws is terrible!
{LEAD}{NAME} throws a piece of meat into the hungry jaws. The thing responds immediately. Apparently satisfied, the giant mouth closes!
The mouth is tightly closed.

{LEAD}{NAME} and {HIS } companions notice a very strange sight here. ^ The pulsating walls appear to be alive, even more than the already familiar green plant walls. An intensive hay and herb-like odor is in the air.

Everyone senses that this is a special place. An indescribable feeling overtakes {LEAD}{NAME} and {HIS } companions. All of their senses grow more intense and every heartbeat pounds through their bodies. It is one those rare moments where you can feel that you are {FAT } alive {NORS}. ^ ^ Strange luminous shapes wander through the room. At the other end stands a large transparent structure. ^ ^ Behind the rotating object the remains of a human body can be seen.

{LEAD}{NAME} and the others are overcome by the luminous shape! ^ A pleasurable feeling, which rises to an almost painful intensity, flows through all of them. A combination of well-being and unrest arises. The contact leaves the humans with headaches and great dizziness.
The large structure is remotely similar to the forehead organ of the Iskai. It radiates a feeling of vitality and life force. The heads of {LEAD}{NAME} and {HIS } companions grow dizzy.
The remains of a human body can be seen behind the rotating form.
A luminous shape. Getting close to it triggers a slight feeling of dizziness.
{LEAD}{NAME} cautiously touches the structure's surface...
{INK 001}{LEAD}{NAME} cautiously touches the structure's surface... {INK 002} ^ ^ "AIIEE!" ^ ^ "Oh man, that felt like someone set my spine on fire. Oh, God, my head! Damn, that hurts BAD!"

{INK 001}{LEAD}{NAME} cautiously touches the surface of the structure... ^ ^ {INK 002} "Oh, I feel something! ^ It is as if I had touched the Trii of another person, only much stronger! ^ ^ I... I'm getting distinct contact with..."
"So that is what Argim, or what has become of him, meant!"
This wall is penetrated by many deep cracks.
{LEAD}{NAME} strikes a mighty blow against the weak point. The wall collapses and opens a passage!
A luminous shape. Getting close to it creates a pleasant tickling sensation.

{LEAD}{NAME} cautiously touches the luminous object. It suddenly expands and encompasses all of the companions before it goes out! A pleasant feeling passes like a wave through {LEAD}{NAME} and the others.
"What a wonderful feeling! But what in the world was that?"

"There are stories about the 'Lights of the Goddess,' which exist in particularly blessed places in the world. They elevate the discoverer and bring him luck. This is the first time I have seen such a light. What an experience!"
"A nice tale, honorable Drirr. However, I wish I had a set of measuring devices so I could investigate the phenomenon..."
Strange-looking flying animals hover in the air. As soon as they see their visitors, they come closer...
The flying animal reaches {LEAD}{NAME}. Its curiosity appears satisfied as it utters a strange sound and then flies away.
"These harmless animals are vegetarians. They generate a luminous gas which allows them to fly like that."
{CNTR} Attack the structure?
"What an experience! Just imagine:..." ^ ^ {INK 001}{LEAD}{NAME} reports to the others about the contact with Argim's consciousness.
{LEAD}{NAME} investigates the pile of old trash, but can find nothing of value.
These could be the remains of an unfortunate victim of the predators in the cave. ^ ^ {LEAD}{NAME} spots something interesting!
A needle shoots out and sticks into {LEAD}{NAME}'s probing finger! This causes a sharp pain!
An old chest, which probably dates back to when this building was occupied. It has a filigreed lock.
{LEAD}{NAME} and the others see the second assassin's corpse in front of them. The beasts of prey have done their work here. ^ ^ Hey, something in the remains sparkles at {LEAD}{NAME}!

"Togi Din, Bero's Saviors. Your deed will be the substance of many stories!"
"Togi Din, travelers. This is Arjano, the Guardian of Knowledge. Welcome to the Center of the Druids of Gratogel. ^ ^ Anyone can see that you come from far away. May I ask what your purpose is here?"
"Togi Din. We come to ask the Druid Bero for a special amulet."
"You want to see Bero, hmm? ^ ^ Please be patient. I will be back shortly."
"So, this is the Center of the Druids. Judging from the access going down, the rest of the center is underground. ^ ^ I was shocked when I saw the little hut."
"Ah, there is the man in the white gown again!"
"Strangers, I have talked with our chief, Nemos. ^ ^ He is ready to meet with you."

"We got into a little fight. I probably have to stay in bed awhile. Darn!"
"Togi Din and much luck in your search for Master Bero!"
"Togi Din! You saved Bero, right? A great deed!"
"Togi Din. This is the work room. Just help yourself to anything that can help you save Bero!"
"Togi Din, Bero's Saviors! Ha, ha, the poor devil will have to listen to a lot of nasty jokes about his failed expedition for a long time!"
"Togi Din. As a student of Bero, it is difficult to study when he may be facing death right now."
"Togi Din! I am glad you have managed to save my Master Bero and he is still in good health. Many thanks to you!"
"Togi Din. I warned Bero about going into the forbidden part! He's such a reckless fellow!"
"Togi Din. Pardon me, I'm busy."
"Welcome, travelers, to Arjano - the 2000 year old school of the Druids."
"Togi Din, Nemos. Pardon me if I bore you with my curiosity, but does your history really go back 2000 years?"
"Indeed, our records go back to the time when the Great Canto led us here from the Land of our Forefathers."
"May I ask where the Land of your Forefathers was and how the trip took place?"
"When the Land of the Forefathers was destroyed by the Crusaders, Canto and Danu led the Chosen Ones through the Kingdom of the Mists here to Albion."
"Now, tell me what brings you here and why do you want to talk with Bero?"
"We have been asked to get a specific amulet. We were told we should see Bero about it."
"I understand. Unfortunately, you can't speak to Bero. I can't even speak to him."
"Why, is he sick or did something happen to him?"
"No. He is dead."
"Did he take a trip?"

"Not at all. He is still in this building. ^ ^ I see I must start further back. As you already know, this building is very old. It was founded shortly after the arrival of the Chosen Ones. The Goddess, Danu, granted us a favor and allowed the building to be built on her land. ^ ^ Now, there are countless parts of the building - far more room than we need. A large part of it has been sealed off for almost 400 years. There was a disagreement with a group of Druids we call the Fire Worshippers, and who ultimately became the Kenget Kamulos. ^ ^ At the time, there was a bitter disagreement which ultimately led to the exodus of the rebels. Structures still maintain traces of the war and are filled with mechanisms and inhabited by demons. ^ ^ In spite of all our objections, Bero climbed down into this part of the building, called Drinno, so he could look for magic artifacts."
"And now you believe that we are the right persons to go looking for him?"
"Right."
"Wouldn't it be better to put together a well-armed search party of warriors from the region?"

"You must know that Drinno, the Forbidden Part, has been taboo for centuries. No one goes down there. ^ ^ But, you seem unaffected by our taboos and I've also heard that the Iskai are fearless warriors."
{INK 001} Tom throws a glance around. {INK 002} ^ ^ "Our continued journey depends upon this amulet. What do you think? Should we undertake the job?"
"Job? If you mean that we should have a look down there, I'm with you."
"I won't retreat at the first sign of danger. I will stay with you, Tom."
"Well, I would dismiss all apparent dangers as superstition if I hadn't already seen what strange things happen here. ^ ^ Don't expect any heroic deeds from me, but I'll go along."

"Well, I'm glad you're willing to help. I can even provide some back up for you. We had a hard time keeping him from going down to Drinno. ^ ^ May I present Bero's foster son, a young Druid by the name of Mellthas. He is deaf and dumb, but his spirit is as bright as the sun. He will accompany you."
{INK 001} Mellthas' face shows a stressed smile, as he bows quickly and hastily writes something on a piece of paper:{INK 002} ^ ^ "I'm pleased! Let's set off soon, I'm very concerned!"

"Bero made provisions for himself before he climbed down. He is no fool. I think he will barricade himself somewhere if he is having difficulty. ^ ^ There is probably no reason to be hasty, but you don't have too much time. ^ ^ The Arjano Druids will support you as much as they can. I wish you Lugh's blessing in the rescue. Should you wish to speak to me, I will be in my room in the east part of this floor."
{INK 001} Mellthas writes and holds up a piece of paper:{INK 002} ^ ^ "Tell me when you are ready to climb down. I will lead you to the entrance. Please hurry."
The Druids look shocked that someone is injured. They give first-aid.
The return proceeds without major problems. Bero is greeted with a warm welcome from some and sharp words from others. They enter the room of Nemo, the Head of the Druids.
"Bero, I think I can save myself the reprimand. You know what you have risked."

"It was certainly a mistake to climb down to Drinno. However, I only regret having put Mellthas and his companions into danger because of my foolishness. ^ ^ I would like to thank all of my rescuers again."

"With which I would like to concur. Bero is quite often a pigheaded plague, but nonetheless I am happy to have him back with us in one piece. ^ ^ ^ Now, as I have understood, a, well... unusual incident has happened between Mellthas and ah... Sira?"
"Nemos, as you can guess we were quite surprised ourselves. We would like to continue this journey together."
{INK 001} Mellthas nods in agreement.
"Well, why not. I wish you much luck, Mellthas ^ ^ Not everyone here in Gratogel would understand the bond between human and Iskai and, so, perhaps it is better if you leave for a while."
"Speaking of continuing the journey: Bero, I must ask you for a specific amulet which we were ordered to procure."
"Of course, Tom. Please follow me into my work room."
"Here you have the Strength Amulet. It is the least I can do for you. ^ ^ I wish you all, and especially you, Mellthas and Sira, Danu's' blessing for your journey."

"Great. What we saw back there was the front room to the inner areas. I have never entered the room from the other side, and I don't know what is there. Also, I cannot tell you how to get there. Let's try and find a way."
The door closed by itself!
The giant flame engulfs everyone! The heat is unbearable!

A very strange view greets the eyes of {LEAD}{NAME} and {HIS } companions: ^ The pulsating walls seem to be alive, more than the already familiar green plant walls. An intense hay and herb-like aroma is noticeable.

Everyone senses that this is a special place. An indescribable feeling overtakes {LEAD}{NAME} and {HIS } companions. All of their senses grow more intense and every heartbeat pounds through their bodies. It is one those rare moments where you can feel that you are {FAT } alive {NORS}. ^ ^ Strange luminous shapes wander through the room. At the other end stands a large transparent structure.
"AIIEE! ^ ^ Oh man, that felt like someone set my spine on fire. Oh, God, my head! Damn, that hurts BAD!"
"Oh, I feel something! ^ It is as if I had touched the Trii of another person, only much stronger. ^ I... I'm getting a distinct contact..."
{LEAD}{NAME} and the others see the corpse of the assassin in front of them. The predators have done their work. ^ ^ However, {LEAD}{NAME} sees something sparkling among the remains!
{LEAD}{NAME} pushes against the plant but it doesn't move.

It was an easy victory. The transparent structure is destroyed. A trembling goes through the area and the living aura leaves the place. ^ ^ Everything around {LEAD}{NAME} and the companions becomes gray and lifeless.

"This battle does not fill me with satisfaction. In spite of its dangers, this was a place of strange beauty. I am afraid that we destroyed something that gave a special life force to the Formers' old center."
"It was a pleasant trip up to now, Driscoll."
"Thank you, I'm in just the right mood to fly today. There's a lot of routine in my job, but flying to a new planet is always exciting."
"You can say that again! It's a good thing my office doesn't know, but I would have given up a week's pay just to experience this moment."
"We're coming into visual range! Look, Hofstedt, it doesn't look like a desert world to me!"
"Indeed! There's a lot of clouds and the color is quite unusual for dust clouds, especially when you consider that the gold color comes from the sun."
"I will speak with the Toronto. Meanwhile, try to get something on your instruments. ^ ^ Shuttle to Toronto! Ned, how's the contact?"
"The reception is excellent, Mr. Driscoll. Are you in visual contact with the target now?"
"Yes. But the planet does not really look like a desert. Mr. Hofstedt is checking the instruments right now."
"Inter...ing. Oh, I th..k the conn...ion is becoming weak... But, continue."
"The dense cloud cover is making measurements difficult. ^ ^ The analysis does show large amounts of raw materials... ^ ^ There appears to be more water than we originally assumed..."
"One mo...nt, Mr. Hofst...t. The con..ct...n is becoming weaker. Are you are having any difficul...? Mr. Driscoll?"
"No. Everything looks O.K. here."
"Wow! I shouldn't have said that! ^ ^ The servos are gone! The auxiliary systems are going down! I'm trying to do something manually! ^ ^ Hofstedt?"
"I'm trying to run a check!"
"Mr. Dr..coll? Your status shows critical values. Report please!"
"Failure of several systems! Manual control O.K.! Trying to turn around!"
"We have problems with the energy supply. I...HEY!"
"It exploded! Oh no, I'm losing control! ^ ^ Hofstedt, hold tight! ^ ^ WE'RE GOING DOWN!"

The shuttle gets caught in the planet's gravitational field and quickly starts to falls towards it! ^ ^ The little ship is rocked heavily as it enters the atmosphere. ^ ^ Tom works feverishly and makes a crash landing with only the manual controls... ^ ^ ^ ^ Slowly, the men come to.
"Ohh, my head! ^ ^ I'm sure in no hurry to fly with you again, Driscoll."
"Certainly not with this shuttle. ^ ^ Nevertheless, you can thank me for your still being alive! The automatic controls wouldn't have brought this thing down safely!"
"O.K., O.K. I get it. ^ ^ What do we do now?"

"Now we put on our masks and climb out. ^ ^ If we can breathe the air, we'll go through the supplies and work on the radio so we can try to make contact. ^ ^ If the air is too thin... that'll be all she wrote."
"Oh, dear. ^ ^ Well, there's no purpose in delaying it. ^ ^ Let's go."
"MY GOD! So this is the desert world! I must be out of my mind! Just look around!"
"Fantastic! Just smell! Listen! This place is humming with life!"
"How could the probe have sent such data? This is a real sensation!"
"First, let's get away from the shuttle. In this oxygen-rich atmosphere it could..."
Everything around Tom bursts into light, then into a darkness that remains for a long time. Then Tom begins to dream his dream again...
{CNTR}{FAHI}FEDDICH!
That dream again.
I have to discuss it with Chris sometime. Time to wake up. I must prepare for the flight.
The flight. ^ ^ The shuttle. ^ ^ Was already there. ^ ^ Has already happened. ^ ^ ^ ^ Pain. ^ ^ ^ ^ ^ Something is wrong, something isn't right. More pain! ^ ^ ^ ^ ^ ^ What happened?

God, the crash! ^ ^ What happened? Oooh, the pain, why don't I wake up? ^ ^ Hofstedt and I are going out... ^ ^ ^ ^ All full of plants and animals. The planet is alive! The colors, the greens, everything is green...
Srrniak? Rriiba nes anrji. Grinaard dra besiir wreniid?
"What in the world... {FAT } ^ ^ WHERE AM I? ^ ^ Who, WHAT is that? {NORS} ^ ^ I thought I was AWAKE! ^ ^ ^ I have to get up and... ^ Ouch! Damn!"
"Quite a clear sign of recovery, I'd say. Welcome back among the living!"

"The owner of this house is practically a legend, at least among the Stiriik. He never speaks more than necessary, and some even think he is a little crazy. But, nobody else knows more about close combat and archery."
{INK 001}{LEAD}{NAME} speaks to the Iskai, who, atypical of his people, sits with stoic calm at the table. The scar-covered Iskai says taciturnly:
"You want to know how to fight, {LEAD}{NAME}. Are you ready?" {BLOK000} "Yes, train me." {BLOK001} "I'd rather not."
"{PRIC} gold. Now."
Suddenly the old warrior comes to life. He stands up with lightning speed and goes to the cushioned combat area with {LEAD}{NAME}.
"It was instructive for you, entertaining for me. You can go now."
{LEAD}{NAME} goes through an intense training program! {HE } has to take some blows, but at the end {HE } realizes that {HE } has made good progress.
The door is locked.
"Good. The art of close-range or long-range combat?" {BLOK000} "Close-range." {BLOK001} "Long- range."
{LEAD}{NAME} receives instruction in handling long-range weapons until {HIS } arm muscles begin to hurt. It is worth the trouble: {HIS } handling of long-range weapons has improved!
{LEAD}{NAME} hands over the amount and begins training.

This strong-filtered viewing port makes it possible to look directly into the heart of the Toronto: the fusion reactor. The tamed forces of a sun supply the installation's energy.
The reactor control panel.
"This is the console I was talking about, Tom. If you cross your fingers, I could make an attempt to cut off Ned, the AI, from the energy supply. Shall I try it?"
Should Joe try to manipulate the console now? {BLOK000} Yes, let's try it! {BLOK001} No, wait a minute.
"Let's not wait too long. I don't want to get caught."
"We've succeeded in getting this far. Now let's try to bring the Seed to the reactor. I'm really anxious to see what will happen..."
"Shall I start now?"
"That's the reactor! Look at the light! They have installed a viewing port which allows only a small part of the fusion's light through. What a fantastic sight!"
Joe gets to work.
"Let's see. I'm no expert with these consoles, but this has to..."
Suddenly, Joe is interrupted by a voice on the loudspeaker!

"Tom Driscoll, Joe Bernard, stop your activities on the control console immediately. ^ ^ Some security personnel are already on the way. I must take both of you into custody. Do not resist; the security personnel are armed."
"Oh no! The AI!"
"Ned! Do you and Brandt really think you can conceal the truth about this planet?"
"Simply put: Yes! ^ ^ The prerequisites are favorable and the chances are good. The existence of the company justifies taking some risk."
"{FAT } WHAT? {NORS} You're telling us, right to our faces, that you consciously intend to destroy this world? ^ ^ I..."
"What's with Captain Brandt? If he cannot show what happened on the flight, he will lose his license forever!"

"That is right. Subsequently Captain Brandt will be subjected to an investigation. Then, naturally, DDT will be forced to fire him. ^ ^ He will have to spend his life as history's richest unemployed person. ^ ^ Unfortunately, I have to keep both of you locked up until the mission is over. Don't worry, we will provide all the conveniences you will need."
"Sure. And the moon is made of green cheese. ^ ^ Joe?"
"Let's go. Quick."
Tom and Joe storm out of the reactor room! They are looking for a lock in the infirmary area which leads outside.
"Hey, we have something to finish here, remember? You don't want to get out again, do you?"
Parts of the reactor system.
When the companions enter the reactor room, Tom comes to his senses.
"Forget it. The show's over, Driscoll. Put your weapons down!"
"Colonel Priver! Let me explain..."
The security guards immediately attack again.
"Damn. ^ ^ I've played cards all night with a some of these men. ^ ^ Damn."
"Let's go into the reactor room."
"Man, I'm happy that we didn't have to fight this time. I knew some of those guys personally. ^ ^ O.K., let's go into the reactor room."
Colonel Priver and his men leave the room.

Just as the companions think they've made it, they see a jet black cylinder standing in front of the reactor core. Only a red control light and a device that seems to have been hastily added on one side interrupt the polished surface.
"That's the actual housing of the AI!"
"Correct. By attacking Colonel Priver and his men you have proven that you are willing to use force and terrorist tactics. I must prevent further malicious destruction of private property myself."
"Correct. After Colonel Priver and his men violated their employment contracts, I see that I am forced to prevent further malicious destruction of private property myself."
"This... barrel is supposed to be a danger to us? I can't believe that!"
"I don't know. That thing on the side of the cylinder looks like a high-powered laser to me..."
{CNTR}{FAHI} The AI attacks!

And now follows a battle between the party and the laser-armed AI in its indestructible housing. When two party members are unconscious, and the party begins to despair, the SEED begins to glow. If it is used now, the following final sequence appears. ^ ^ The final sequence is still being composed and debugged!
The AI attacks immediately.
In despair, Tom throws the glowing seed toward the reactor core!
{INK 001} The seed becomes the center of a shining light!

A trembling passes through the enormous structure of the Toronto. At first inaudible, the metal vibrates louder and louder, while pale sparkling lights crawl over the hull. ^ ^ Suddenly, shoots and blossoms in uncountable colors break through the metal! ^ ^ The steel screeches as it is torn apart and distorted by the force of the plants!
Even those crew members who were not convinced by the documentation flee frightfully from the ship. ^ ^ When they emerge into the open, the Toronto presents an unbelievable sight...

The effect of the seed is simpler than its creators believed, and yet stronger than anyone had held possible: ^ ^ Within minutes, the giant installation of the Toronto has been destroyed. ^ ^ Destroyed? Or recreated? The gigantic manifestation of terrestrial technology is replaced by an oasis in the middle of the desert. This one time, the irrational and magical have prevailed against the power of calculating reason.
"We..." "We're still alive!" ^ ^ "{FAT } We're still alive! {NORS}"
The wounded companions wake up at Tom's cry...
"Look at that! Everything is overgrown with plants!"
"Yes! The metal colossus is dead!"
"No. It is alive now."
"The energy is gone, the AI is gone! ^ ^ I still can't believe we've survived. ^ ^ Let's try to get out of here. I wonder what the Toronto looks like from the outside?"
"{FAT } Wow! {NORS}" ^ ^ The seed took its job quite literally! What a sight!"
"Ha! That's what I call magic! Fantastic! I can tell you, that alone was worth the danger!"
"It's beautiful! What an irony: Without the ship's immeasurable energy, such a feat could not have been possible. ^ ^ The wound in Animebona's side has been closed, the pain is gone."

"The great adventure is over, friends. Now we must get back to everyday business. Over there are a number of men and women, including one I care a lot about, to whom I have to explain that this world is now their new home and their only future. ^ ^ Let's go..."
{FAHI}{INK 003}{CNTR}THE END
"The seed detonates the reactor! We are {FAT }DEAD{NORS}!"

{CNTR}{INK 001}Welcome to a work-in-progress - version of ^ {HIGH}ALBION{NORS}. ^ {JUST} Please keep in mind that this version is BY NO MEANS REPRESENTATIVE OF THE GAMEPLAY of the finished product! There are still some essential parts of the program missing. Please refer to the printed manual which is enclosed with this CD. ^ ^ Currently you are in a demo-map, which gives you access to different areas of ALBION. Press Alt-F7 to return to this map. Just go through the doors to take a look at the exceptionally wide range of in-game-graphics. Except for the user-interface, all texts are still in German, sorry. ^ ^ How to play: Simply put, if you want to move, use the left mouse-button, if you want to do or to cancel something, press (or hold down) the right mouse-button. That's it, have fun poking around. ^ ^ PLEASE TAKE A LOOK AT THE MANUAL!

REMARK: It's possible to do some simple puzzle-solving in the next 3D-scenario. Your goal is simply to reach the exit of this level, a ladder similar to the one where you've been entering the map. If you find a keyboard on the wall, the correct code is 1042.

REMARK: The next 2D-scenario allows you to do some puzzles based on the functions of the program that are already included. There are a lot of hints by one of the members of your party since this is still a beginners scenario, but alas, they're in German, too.
REMARK: This is one of the game's areas which we have started to fill with life. The persons who don't answer if you try to speak to them, will come up with a special dialogue screen shortly.
REMARK: To leave the next room, step on the green plate on the floor, and watch the greenish transparent walls!

"I am worried about what lies ahead in our search for the Toronto's landing place."

"This little hut holds an important center of knowledge? That can hardly be possible!"
A locked door in the entryway blocks access to the hut.
"Togi Din! Visitors from foreign countries again, how exciting!"
"Togi Din, travelers. Isn't it a beautiful day?"
"Togi Din. Excuse me, but I'd rather not talk right now. My husband drowned recently and I..." ^ ^ {INK 001} Tears run down the young woman's face.
{INK 001} A small girl is running around exuberantly. She cries: ^ ^ {INK 002} "Togi Din! Make way for the great warrior! Yeehaaa!"
"Togi Din! Do you want to travel over the sea with my father? Ah, I would like him to take me along once."
Finally, Tom and his companions feel solid ground under their feet again. ^ ^ They say good-bye to the crew and look around...

"Look at that, Tom! I am not very knowledgeable in history, but these huts look like Celtic round huts! ^ ^ Not only are there humans on this planet, but apparently, there are even descendants of the Celts! That's completely impossible!"

"As impossible as the strange phenomena that we have observed with the Iskai? The magic? ^ ^ Don't look at me like that, someone had to say it! This planet obviously does not work like ours, and it doesn't seem to be at all ashamed about it. ^ ^ Come on, let's be a little more pragmatic about this. When we have found the Toronto, we'll have enough time and means to get to the bottom of all the riddles this world has to offer."

"Maybe you're right. It's probably time I expand my outlook on natural science a little. I shouldn't resist learning something new. ^ ^ A proposal of pragmatism: I think we should speak with the village's chief. He will probably know if something big enough to be the Toronto has been seen around here. If the people here have something to do with the Celts, there must be a tribal king or someone like that."
"If they haven't heard anything about your giant airship here, we can try to get to Maini, the large continent east of here."
"That's a perfectly normal Earth pig!"
"If people have somehow managed to get here, I guess it's not surprising that they've brought their domestic animals with them."
A canyon through the high plateau opens before {LEAD}{NAME} and {HIS } companions. The wind whistles through the narrow, closed corridor.
Tom and his companions board the ship and later begin the trip to Beloveno, the great harbor city.

Drirr again uses the passing time to teach everyone the Maini language. ^ ^ The time flies by until finally Maini looms on the horizon. ^ ^ Before long, a magnificent view of the new land and of Beloveno, the harbor city, appears.
Garris maneuvers the ship skillfully into the harbor and says farewell to his passengers.
"Well, that's over with. Let's take a look at the city."
Suddenly several shabby mean-looking persons jump out of a hiding place! ^ ^ They attack!
A small animal with an armor-like shell. It ignores its surroundings.
A large, insect-like flying animal. It ignores {LEAD}{NAME} and the others.
A harvested bush.
This is an oak tree from Earth!
-free-
{CNTR} "Rriik?"
"Togi Din, young people! It certainly would be nice to be young and travel once more!"
"Rifrako, that strange character, has an amulet which warns you when you are being hunted by a wild animal or something even worse. What a valuable thing to have!"
"Togi Din, travelers. Go into Benno's Shop, the harvest was so good that he has dropped his prices!"
"Togi Din, great people! My mother says I shouldn't speak to strangers, but I do it anyway!"
"{CNTR} On the shield is written: ^ ^ {INK 006} To Aballon: Keep to the Southwest

This climbing plant, with its thousands of roots, has anchored itself into the irregular rock structure. It appears to be very stable and, with its many branches, offers sufficient support for rock climbing.
A Celtic hut.
An entrance into a Celtic hut.
A fence separating the animal pen.
A gate in the rail fence.
A city wall.
A gate in the city wall.
Territorial fences, which makes one wonder how the original inhabitants managed to deal with such steep slopes...
"Oink."
The animal says nothing in reply.
"During the day, I have to harvest the fields and tend to the cattle. I come from Srimalinar, the Iskai city northwest of Maini."
A cave entrance.
{LEAD}{NAME} finds a hidden treasure.
Kounos.

It is strangely quiet in Kounos. No human sound is heard and something almost sinister lies over the village. The villagers have probably gathered at the shrine of Srimalinar to fight the Iskai and occupy their shrine.
"Begone! We have to defend this position."
"Don't worry - we'll attack soon and put an end to the horrors."

People are looking angrily at {LEAD}{NAME} and the others. An Iskai in the front rows says: ^ ^ "Is it true that you are looking for evidence to incriminate Kontos? Even if you were to find such evidence, I doubt it would prevent a war. I don't know when the Mahinos will attack, but as you can see they're not very peaceful." ^ ^ Some Mahinos reply immediately: ^ ^ "Nonsense! ^ We will put an end to this farce and show the world what actually goes on in that weird building. We're only waiting for Kontos to give the attack order." ^ ^ {LEAD}{NAME} scans the crowd for Kontos, but doesn't see him. ^ ^ Because of the tense situation, {LEAD}{NAME} and {HIS } companions decide not to go into the shrine. ^ ^ If only someone could find evidence against Kontos... Maybe it would be helpful to speak to all of the people again. Or perhaps something incriminating can be found in Kontos' laboratory. Or in the Iskai town of Srimalinar? After all, the Iskai are the most affected by this and they surely aren't completely ignorant.
Tom walks between the two parties and holds up the incriminating document for everyone to see. The crowd grumbles as Kontos suddenly comes out of the shrine and immediately speaks to his people:
"Don't believe him! Don't fall into the trap! This is really a very simple trick. They are trying to mislead you. The document is a falsification!"
"If even half of the document matches the part that Edjirr has kept, then it is genuine. Please, may I see the document at once?"

Tom gives the document to a small group of Iskai people. Several others gather around as they begin to examine the document. Darios suddenly emerges from the rows of the Mahinos and asks the Iskai if he, too, can examine the document. The small group converges while Kontos does all he can to calm the Mahinos, who are quickly becoming more and more skeptical. ^ ^ {LEAD}{NAME} and {HIS } companions move to where they can address both groups. They tell the Iskai and the Mahinos about their recent conversations and the evidence they have found. Both groups grow restless and the gathering turns into a great pandemonium. ^ ^ Kontos stands there, petrified, as he recognizes that he is losing all control. Finally, he makes one last effort and shouts:
"Listen to me! What I am saying is true! I will prove to you that this place is full of horror and terror! I will enter the shrine and return with proof once and for all."
"If you desecrate our shrine we will take revenge!"
"Bah - Shrine - Empty words."

Kontos enters the holy building, closely followed by several Iskai. ^ ^ In the meantime, Darios has returned to his clan brothers. Immediately, all gather around as he begins talking hastily. The Mahinos look confused and upset. The Iskai seem concerned as well. Then, after some time, a speaker steps forward and announces:

"We are certain that the document is genuine and that we fully understand its contents. Darios will agree with us, as he has seen the document for himself. ^ ^ The document is a contract between Kontos, Riko, and Gard. A long time ago, the three of them discovered something that we never knew. Under our holy vault lie large amounts of valuable metals and minerals. This also explains why someone - probably Kontos - entered the shrine and dug several holes: he was probably taking samples. Kontos is intelligent; with his good geographical knowledge, he probably knew that this was a prime location for minerals and metal deposits. And so, we now understand that our shrine has been standing on a valuable metal mine for generations and we have never known about it. It is easy to understand Kontos' plans now. With his purposeful rumors, he wanted to convince everyone that the shrine was dangerous for all Maini. Fortunately, he only partially succeeded. The plan suggested destroying the shrine so that the valuable ores could be mined quietly. Gard and Riko's part in this plot was to monitor the situation in Beloveno. They were spreading the same rumors there. As thanks for their support, naturally, they were to have shared in the profits. The document even specifies the shares. Also, they have used their influence in the council on Kontos' behalf. But, Kontos also made a grave mistake: He assumed that Mother Earth would allow the ores to be given away to criminals without Her consent. Naturally, Kontos does not believe in such things. He thinks that everything can be solved with mathematics and magic.
"But those horrible creatures. They were here, weren't they? Some of them are still being found. Didn't they come out of the shrine?"

"No, they were also creations of Kontos. He is the only magician in all of Maini who is able to create and call forth such creatures. All of his closest confidants can confirm that. He succeeded in two things with these creatures: he was able to test his magic and create false evidence that could support his claims. Fortunately, our kind of magic is incapable of doing these things."

This long address unsettles even the last Mahino who still stands behind Kontos. A new unrest spreads and there is intense discussion among the Mahinos. ^ ^ It looks as if they cannot believe they have been used as mere tools in Kontos' greedy plans. And, even if some questions are still unanswered, it is still clear that the people of Kounos have been deceived. ^ ^ {LEAD}{NAME} and the others have prevented the worst, and now it is just a matter of time before the two groups can reconcile. The more reasonable Mahinos apologize to the Iskai; others head back to Kounos-offended and depressed. One thing is clear for both groups-they are thankful for your intervention and peaceful solution. Both Iskai and Mahinos invite you to visit them again soon. ^ ^ Suddenly, you remember that there is still one big problem. ^ ^ What is Kontos doing in the shrine?
A small bush with seeds.
The entrance to the shrine.
It would probably be better not to break the taboo! Tom and the others think it is better not to enter the shrine.
The entrance to this hut is closed.
To Srimalinar - north over the bridge.
Human beings may not enter the holy site of the Iskai.

"Hmm... I think there's trouble brewing here. I suggest we try to find out more about this problem by talking to the important people in each of the cities and villages. Perhaps we can meditate-if we can find something positive we're sure to find some people who'll help us."

"Skeima Din! ^ ^ I'm so glad I finally found you, I've been looking everywhere. Kariah sends me - she has something important to tell you - it is very urgent. I only know that it is a matter of life and death! Please go to her home in Beloveno as fast as you can. Go immediately. If you stop for any reason, it may be too late. You can do your visiting later."
-free-
The powerfully-built man gives {LEAD}{NAME} a dark glance and doesn't respond.

{INK 001}The watchman on the right throws a sharp glance at {LEAD}{NAME} when {HE } tries to examine the door. He says: ^ ^ {INK 002} "Strangers, you are wandering down dangerous paths. Surely, you do not hold life that frivolously that you intend to gain access to the Kenget Kamulos without going through us first?"
There are barely visible, fine cracks in the rock here. ^ ^ All attempts at entry are in vain: No entry can be obtained here.
"My God. We have survived!"
Exhausted, the companions lie down so they can rest and regain their energy.
"Khunag, we have to talk about what has happened with the Kenget Kamulos. ^ ^ You have used us as a tool for your revenge and have consequently risked all our lives."

"I will not apologize for what has happened. Arghagh, the Cuain before that swine of a Cairnain, was the only human being whom I have loved. Cairnain ended the only happy period in my life. At least his death has given me some happiness. ^ ^ I am sure you know I am here for my own motives. ^ I believe, based on what has happened, that I must offer you my services as warrior again. If you say you can do without my talents, I will go. Tell me. What is your decision?"
Should Khunag leave the group?
"I will not have anything to do with anyone who is prepared to sacrifice his companions' lives for his own selfish purposes. ^ ^ I would like you to leave us, Khunag."
"I find it hard to understand your motives, Khunag. ^ ^ But we do need your warrior abilities in battle. ^ ^ You can stay. But, be warned, don't deceive us again."
"As you wish. Farewell."
"My revenge is fulfilled. I place myself in the service of your mission until I have found a new purpose in life."

"This is the entrance to the home of the Kenget Kamulos. ^ ^ I think we should have someone with us who knows their way around before we go in. ^ ^ How about that Khunag character in Beloveno? I have heard that he was once a member of this cult. ^ ^ Let's ask him if he will accompany us in there."
-free-
No answer.
The ship has a small crew of unusually quiet Iskai who seem to know Frill well.
Frill assumes navigation of the boat and so begins a several day voyage to the south.
Finally, a curtain of mist comes into view on the horizon. The small ship rapidly approaches it...

{LEAD}{NAME} says suddenly: ^ "I'm feeling strange again. If only we had bought that stuff in Umajo-Kenta. It would probably help us now."
The group is very exhausted from wandering through the desert. Everyone's capabilities are draining drastically.
The group is injured from all the wandering in the desert.
"I travel from Umajo-Kenta to the prison and back again."
This is the entrance to the prison.
The lock appears to be very solid. Even a thief could not figure out how to pick it.
With a loud crash, the prison door locks again. It won't reopen without a key.
{INK 001} The jailer speaks to the group: ^ {INK 002} "Skeima Din. ^ Normally, strangers cannot enter here. But if you like you can come and visit."
"Would you like to visit the prison?"
Ssssssss...
"How dare you show your face here again! Do you want to help another prisoner escape? ^ ^ I think you better leave!"

Ssssss...
