"I'm traveling back and forth between the prison and Umajo-Kenta to get food."
A blocked entrance.
"Let's see if Ohl is going to show up."
"I'm glad you're here. But, to help you, I would first like a jewel."
"Can I look in your backpack for a jewel?"
"In that case, I will not lead you to the entrance."
"Unfortunately, you do not have a jewel. I will not show you the entrance unless you can give me a jewel! However, we can gladly meet again if you can offer me a stone."

"Thank you very much, that's a very beautiful stone. I only have 27 of this kind, while I have 235 rubies. You just can't imagine how happy I am! I'll add it to my collection later. ^ ^ Beautiful, now follow me. I will show you the entrance! Always stay behind me. You can easily lose your way between the boulders."

"Well, here we are. You can see the door in that large boulder on the left. It is right behind the flower of the insect-eating plant. ^ ^ Thanks again for the jewel, and I wish you well on your journey! I really have to get back now, I'm sure you understand, it's not every day you get a new jewel. It's a lot of work-I have to polish it, examine it, scrutinize it, illuminate it, display it, show it to my friends, etc. I will surely be busy until the day after tomorrow! ^ ^ Have a good trip, Skeima Din!"
"These rock symbols have been around for a long time. They are found on the entire planet, but nobody knows where they came from."
{LEAD}{NAME} places the amulet with the symbol of the Goddess on the rock. ^ ^ The door creaks open and the companions enter the cave.

"This heat is incredible! ^ ^ This is the land of the Umajo, the Metalmakers. According to our information, the great metal ship went down somewhere south of these mountains. ^ ^ The wall to the west, is part of Umajo Kenta, the city of metal and jewels."
-free-
-free-
"I think it's too risky to get close to the Toronto now. Let's find another way."
With some effort Tom pulls himself together.
"So far so good. Let's try to creep up to the Toronto while it's dark."

Avoiding the work machines and excavations, the companions actually reach the Toronto unnoticed. Tom succeeds in opening a side entrance without triggering an alarm. He closes the hatch as soon as everyone is inside.
When the companions come out of the tunnel, Tom utters a cry:
"Look! Back there flies a shuttle from the Toronto!"
The shuttle approaches. Apparently, the companions have been spotted. It lands!
{INK 001} Turning to his companions, Tom says: ^ ^ {INK 002} "Come! Don't be afraid! It will be a little tight inside there, but we'll only have to be in there for a short time."
Tom climbs in and notices that there's no pilot. The shuttle is remote-controlled.

Suddenly the shuttle door slams shut! Tom is locked in without the companions and the shuttle starts! ^ ^ During the takeoff, a gas fills the cabin. Tom loses consciousness and drops to the floor! He remembers nothing about the flight...
Tom and Joe succeed in avoiding the Toronto search party. Tom is heading to the cave which leads under the mountains to Umajo Kenta. They reach their destination at dawn.
Everyone embraces each other excitedly. After the initial joy of seeing each other again, Tom introduces Joe and roughly outlines what has happened.
"We were afraid of something like that, Tom. I've already had a discussion with the other Dji Cantos. ^ ^ Let's return to the island so we can decide what to do next!"
What Tom only dared to hope has happened: ^ ^ The companions have waited for his return.
-free-

"I have no time for you!"
"If you are visiting, then please do not disturb our conversations."
"Skeima Din, I am the cook here. It's tough to work behind a stove all day."

"Do you know who you are talking to? You have one of the most famous Equipment Makers standing before you. I was instrumental in the development of the poison needle locks, yes indeed! Don't you recognize an important person when you see one? Naturally, I will give you my autograph if you like. Would you like it? ^ ^ Hmm, you don't look like you want it! People don't have respect for their elders anymore!"
-free-
A beautiful ornament embedded in the ground. The symbol indicates this is the guild of the Diamond Polishers.

"Skeima Din, ^ ^ Kemilo is my name. I work on fine jewelry here in the workshop. My specialty is making tiny locks for necklaces and rings. They are actually so tiny that you can hardly see them. You need a very steady hand and good tools to do this. ^ ^ But since I was originally an Equipment Maker, this is easy for me."
"Coskon told me that you are looking for someone who will teach you how to master locks and keys. I don't want to let him down, so I'm prepared to show you."
"Would you like to practice picking locks and disarming traps?"
"You are welcome to come by again."

"Skeima Din, are you looking for someone? Can I help you in some other way? If you have special questions, you should ask Coskon. He is the leader of the guild and can tell you whatever you need to know."
"Ouch! Aargh, I just sawed into my finger."
"Now my fingernail is bleeding too!"
"Just before this I dropped a polishing stone on my foot. {FAT }Everything{NORS}hurts!"
"Please do not bother me. I am supposed to polish two more rubies today and I have no idea how I'm going to get it done by the end of the day."
"I am Coskon's wife. I do the housekeeping and cook for the guild members."
"I am not allowed to talk with strangers, but I must always be polite."

"Do you want to buy something? That would sure please Uncle Mykonou. His eyes always shine when he sells something ... oops... when he finds out that I told you this, he will be angry. Please don't say anything."

{LEAD}{NAME} and the others stand in awe as the spinning jewel grows to ten times its original size. Clearly, the jewel has magical powers, but what are they? According to the legend, whoever touches the stone can read the minds of others....
A gigantic jewel spins on the ornament and flashes a clear red. The entire object glows astonishingly.

{LEAD}{NAME} touches the stone and tries to read someone's mind, but doesn't succeed in spite of {HIS } intense efforts. However, there is a restorative, pleasant force which flows through {HIS } body.
{CNTR}{INK 006} ^ Please do not touch the jewels in the display! ^ is written on the shield.
-free-
A beautifully decorated ornament is embedded in the floor. It is the symbol of the Weaponsmiths, and represents their guild.
"I watch what people buy here. I do it whenever I have the chance. They also tell stories of their adventures here."
"This is a good store. Only the best goods and fairly priced!"
"Do we know each other?"
"Have a beautiful day."
{CNTR} "What are you doing taking my things with you. {INK 006}{FAHI} Put them back immediately!"
{CNTR}{FAHI} "Don't you hear well? Get your hands off my things!"
The living areas are not accessible to strangers.
-free-
A decorated ornament embedded in the floor.
An entrance to the tunnels.
"Up to now, I've been caught every time. I saw a good niche on the right. I'll try to hide there."

"My goodness, there's always so much dust getting into my lungs. It's really bad when you work underground for a long time. I should get something to cover my nose for when I go into these tunnels-otherwise, I can't breathe properly. This really isn't a very healthy place to work and, can you believe, all kinds of people complain that we ask too much for our ores and jewels!"
"I clean the washrooms and bathrooms for the miners."

"Skeima Din, Bekkina is my name. Are you visiting here? Well, great. Have a good look around. You might run into my husband. He is a Mountain Priest, and is always working around here. He only has one colleague and cannot take a lot of breaks. We have a hard time because of it. The rumors that we demand too much gold are completely exaggerated. No one is given anything here."
"I'm a little tired. Unfortunately, I had to work all day yesterday. Please excuse me."
"Have you seen Zebenno here? He really gets on my nerves. He's always complaining about our prices. He probably has nothing better to do. Well, I guess I'll find him myself. Have a nice day."
"Well I'll be, visitors don't normally wander into my kitchen. But welcome. I am Rekkejos and I'm the cook here."
"Meat and dumplings soup."
"Fish pieces in herb sauce."
"Vegetable souffléé with sugo."
"Fresh pastries and vegetable paste."
"Baked Acarva and tasty yellow mushrooms."
"Today I'm making cross-laid rib fish with double-leafed herbs."
"I can't decide-I'll probably make another pot."
"Fruit souffléé with goat sauce."
"Berry cake with meat sauce."
"Bratwurst with tree salad."
"Today, there's going to be a cold plate."
"I can't think of anything more! What else can I make for today?"
"Skeima Din. I help Rekkejos with the cooking. He's always busy, because all of the miners eat here. You can't imagine what kind of cooking feasts go on here. Of course, my master is a real chef."
"Skeima Din. If you are visiting, I can arrange a room for the night."
"Have you already heard of the great 'Stone of the 1000 Visions'? Mykonou, the old diamond polisher, told me about it."
"Hello! You people say 'Hello', don't you?"
"I'm playing right now. Do you want to join me?"
"Ha ha, why are you wearing those funny clothes?"
"Well, little one, when you are bigger your Mommy will explain it to you. We're not from around here and, where we come from, this is normal clothing."
"Bah-I'm thirsty."
"Would you like to know what's for dinner today?"
"I believe that it's better if I go in there alone. The Miners have forbidden us to enter the tunnels. I have a better chance of getting in by myself."
"I've found out the secret word of the ceremony. I hope it's the right one."
A metal can.
"Would you like to spend the night here?"

"Wow, it's great to see someone I can talk to. I'll tell you, this is really a dreary job. Day in and day out I sit here. Of course, I understand this work has to be done, but why me? Never mind, complaining won't help."
"You shouldn't leave levers lying around or stuck in the switches. Any prisoner can escape if they can get out of the vault."
"I'm leaving a lever on the table for you so that you can leave the prison again. Please don't leave the lever lying around. The mechanism is simple, you'll figure it out."

"I think we better go now..."

"Every day I make my way to the prison so that I can relieve the other guard. Do you want to come with me? I'm warning you; it's a long and difficult way."

"Ha! So we meet again. You're fools, ha ha. But I will not be unfair and I will give you some of the information I promised. The first piece of information: I was not entirely truthful when I explained my past to you. But, I would like to make up for that. If you're looking for a shortcut to the southern part of the continent, I can show you the entrance to the tunnel system. There are only a few of us who know where the portal is. If you're interested, we can meet at midnight in front of the city gate. Go on, don't bother me anymore. I need to return to my work."

From not too far away, someone calls out: {CNTR}{INK 006} "We have her!" "Take that, you bitch!" {LEFT}{INK 001} There appears to be a huge battle, and according to the shouting, Nelly has come out badly.
"Skeima Din, are you here for a visit or are you a new resident of Umajo-Kenta? Our city is getting so big."
"I have to buy some more."
"Hopefully you're here with peaceful intentions. I'm never quite sure when I run into a group of people I don't know."
"Watch out for sand divers when you wander through the desert. They are horrible animals, and they can't be seen since they lurk under the sand. But they can hear steps many miles away."
-free-
On the shield it says: {CNTR}{INK 006} Fresh Food, Best Quality
"Hopefully you are not shocked by our food prices. But, keep in mind that everything is delivered by ship."
"Everyone is always so thirsty. Make sure you carry water with you, especially if you are going through the desert."
"Hello..." {INK 001} the little girl says shyly.
"Skeima Din."
"Skeima Din, I'm Keralt, Equipment Maker by profession. Have you been to our guild?"
"Do you really have to gossip with {FAHI}every{NORS} stranger?"
-free-
The shopkeeper obviously does not like strangers going behind the counter and taking valuable merchandise without paying for it.
"Skeima Din, strangers. Are you interested in some jewelry? I have a large collection. If you visit the Diamond Polishers' guild, you will be able to see a part of my collection."
"No, thank you. I don't want to buy anything."
"I shouldn't speak with strangers."
"Have you already been to the northern part of this continent? That's where you can visit the prison which holds all who tried to steal from others, heh heh."
free
Prisoners are behind these bars. Since the barred doors look very stable, there is no danger.
This door leads to the front room. It is locked.
This door leads to the front room. It is open.
An empty key ring board.
A key hangs on this key ring board.
{INK 006} No room for luggage.
"I want out of here! Let me out!!!"
"The world is unjust and frustrating! But, who are we-we're just mere grains of sand."
"Just leave me alone, unless you want a knife between your ribs."
"Say hello to the world for me. I haven't seen the sun for a long time. But I'm gonna get out of here soon! I'll be sooo glad to breathe fresh, warm air again."
-free-
"Sskkeima Din...Brothers and Sisters...isn't it a wonderful day?"

"I'll never play again! I've lost over 1000 gold coins. That's almost as much as I had to give Nelly that time she hit me over the ear. I tell you, people around here don't play fair. Don't let them talk you into a game!"
"Have you talked to Konny yet? She generally comes here when she has time. She likes talking to people about their travels. When you meet her, just talk to her."

"Heh heh, as I see, you've already been stung by some insects. Fortunately, most of them are harmless. There are a lot of gnats and insects flying around the desert. That's why the meat-eating plants do so well there. Just look how they catch the insects."
"Don't you see that I'm thirsty? Out of the way!"
"Hopefully, I will be as big as you are soon! Then I can go wherever I want."
{INK 002} The small girl looks at you, terrified, but doesn't say anything.
"It's so boring here. There's nobody to talk to, and none of my friends are around here. My parents never leave me alone..."

"If I were you, I wouldn't go into the southern part of the desert! For some time, there has been a loud, horrible roaring sound and I saw some huge object drop right out of the sky. It blinked, and flashed, and spun around. I've never seen such a huge thing! Most people don't believe me, but I saw it with my own eyes. No one can deny that they've heard that mighty thunder, but everyone has their own explanation for it. They just don't want to admit I'm right. I'm sure it's something bad. I wouldn't go there if I were you. Well, I won't say anything more since they already think I'm a pessimist here. But, if you want, you can talk to other people about the thunder noise."
-free-
A metal bathtub.
"None shall pass!"
"But, we have an important reason! The future of your people may depend on it!"
"Mmm, that sounds pretty important. Okay, we'll let you through. But I warn you, if you're lying, we'll get you for it."
"I've got not time. I've got to do all of the bookkeeping for this season."
"Good day, I've already heard from the guards that you have come here on an urgent matter. Have you seen Sojekos yet? He is the chief here. In any case, you should go to him."
"Nja? Well, hmm! Well, I don't know what you want of me, nja?"
"We didn't want to disturb you."
"Nja? Nja. Skeima Din."
"Heh heh, that was a real funny guy."

"Skeima Din, has anyone shown you the accommodations here? In the middle part of the building, you will find the different conference rooms; in the northwest there is a dormitory; in the southwest, the kitchen and its supply rooms. You can also get a little bite to eat there if you're hungry. In the eastern part of the building, there are the guest rooms. There is a washroom and some beds. The exit is located in the middle corridor."
"So, I need two more spice flies and Jabba-paste. Oh darn, I haven't mixed that yet. Could you please get out of my way? You're always under my feet..."
"Where is Kotilla now? If you don't keep an eye on the little ones all the time... I told her she should stay here. If you see her, please tell her to come home immediately. She has to take a bath."
"I don't want a bath! I don't want one!!! I had a bath ten days ago. I can't. I'm not going. She won't find me. I can hide really well. But please don't say that you saw me here."

"I am the Ultimate Supreme Chief Director of Umajo-Kenta and I order you to bow down before me! All of you! Faces to the ground! And I herewith find you guilty of disobedience and condemn you all to the DEATH PENALTY, which is to be CARRIED OUT IMMEDIATELY..."
A woman's voice is heard from the next room: "Prijukos, you've played enough today! Now come back in here; you still have to take a bath!"
"Nooooooo! I don't want to take a bath! We always have to take baths! It's so horrible! Mommy, I'm still very clean since the last bath. I'd rather play the Ultimate Supreme Chief for a while..."
"You come in here right now, IMMEDIATELY..."
"I guess I'm gonna have to take a bath or she'll get really mad..."
"But Mommy, I've already had a bath today... ohh, you're not Mommy. Who are you? You must be the important visitors!"
"Tomorrow our cook is making more sweet cakes. Mmm, I love sweet cakes."
"Skeima Din. May I present myself: Peukko is my name. I'm the representative for Sojekos. But, since he is in now, you should go directly to him if you have a request."
"Would you like to have a little something to eat?"
"Enjoy it."
-free-
"Skeima Din. I am one of the prison guards and am on the way to relieve my colleague. But, first, I must get some of Agida's delicious meals. After all, it's a long haul through the desert."
"Hello?!"
"Perhaps today I can stay up a while longer."
"Mommy!!! Mommy!!! ^ ^ There are some people here I don't know!"
"I live here when I am not hunting and supplying Kyla with fresh meat. Are you the traveling group everyone is talking about?"
"I'm allowed to cook something for myself!"
free
These stone columns block a part of the cave. They look porous. Between the columns you can see a passage leading onward.
Unfortunately, kicks and punches cannot conquer these great columns. {LEAD}{NAME}'s hand is paying the price. It really hurts now!
This column is probably too hard. It can hardly be destroyed with the tool.
The object doesn't affect this stone column.
"What a blow! ^ ^ I think we can crawl through here if we make ourselves thin."

The stone column has tumbled down. There is still a large stump on the ground and a stalactite-like object hangs from the ceiling. Everything is covered with sand and stones. However, the passage has gotten bigger. Perhaps you can force your way through with some effort.
A chest.
The chest is not locked. Who could have put it here?
The door leads to a rock gate.
-free-
A decorated metal chest.
An old diamond-polishing machine.
An oil lamp.
The lever cannot be moved. {LEAD}{NAME} pulls with all of {HIS } might, but fails. It appears as if the lever is locked in some way.
The lever has already been moved. Now it is stuck again.
This is a cable duct. There is probably a connection between the handle and the knives in the floor behind it.
These are very sharp knives, which are stuck in the floor. They all appear to be connected.
The knives do give way upon being struck with the hammer, but something under the floor still seems to be holding them in.
The knives are stuck in the openings.
It is easy to beat the knives back with the hammer and clear the way.
A room full of swords and knives. Some are broken already.
These are very sharp knives which are stuck in the floor. They are arranged completely at random and appear to have been part of an experiment.
{CNTR} The shield says: ^ {INK 006}{FAT } Attention, mortal danger! ^ If all three levers are activated at the same time, mechanism will overload! ^ Pay attention to current switch positions!
Knife raiser for connecting room in the southwest.
Knife raiser for central hall in the east.
Knife raiser for mine in the northwest.
The mechanism overloaded.
These knives appear particularly stable. They can surely be removed-but how to do this is unknown.
Ahh, the knives continue behind the wall to the left! There appears to be a whole chain of them.
The lock is pretty rusty. It is of poor quality.
Some part of the lock is broken. It is open.
A contact plate.
Central hall.
It appears that nothing happened.
Apparently, the magic power is gone since the objects do not change anymore.
The object has changed.
My invention can change swords. ^ You just have to do it the right way! ^ ^ Akka.
The door is locked and the keyhole is blocked with a metal bolt. If the door can be opened, then certainly not with any key.
An entrance into a mine.
A circuit diagram.
A metal foot switch.
-free-

{LEAD}{NAME}says "We won't get very far this way" and points to the ground. Now it becomes obvious to the others that the track stops right at the entrance. However the tunnel is easily accessible on foot.
"Wow, I believe we just ran through a wall! It was probably just an illusion. But, boy, it sure looked real."
A staircase.
There is a hole in the ceiling.
The hole, into which Tom and the others have fallen, is too high to be able to climb back up with a rope.
A table with a chest.
A hot flame.
"Ouch!"
"The door has opened!"
This door cannot be opened with a key.
A button on the wall.
A pitfall.
An iridescent, magic curtain.
The handle sticks!
{CNTR} An inscription on the wall. ^ {INK 006}{FAT } Get back!
{LEAD}{NAME} discovers a hidden button on the wall!

No lock, no latch, and no switch can be seen. The door probably can only be opened using some hidden mechanism. The colors of the flames are reflected very differently in the door. Red and green tones are very noticeable. But, the blue tones cannot be seen at all. The door is probably light-sensitive.

"Look! ^ This wall has some kind of rail mechanism around the edge. It looks really peculiar. I guess it can be lowered from a lever in the floor. It also has a fireplace. Perhaps a fire energizes the mechanism. ^ ^ I really believe that walls like this can be controlled by the many levers."
"Now what has this lever done? It is probably connected to one of these rail walls."
"There is some kind of spring here."
A terrifying noise is coming from the north. It sounds as if a hole were being drilled into the ground.
"Did you hear that grinding? I believe that it came from the room where we came in."
A wall on rails.
-free-
A hole in the floor.
-free-
The door sticks, although it is not locked.
Whoever would like to go through the doors may go through the doors!
This door cannot be opened by hand.
A magic curtain.
There's a hole in the ceiling-but it's too high to climb up with a rope.
This field looks different from any others seen before.

"Who is bothering me now? What do you want? I'll bet Sebenno has given you the key, that good-for-nothing. Please do not disturb me. I have enough work, and have to carry on with my studies. Before you leave, take a tip from old Kossotto: look out for the demons. ^ ^ Heh heh."

"There you are. I heard you were looking for me. Sojekos has entrusted me with secret information for you, but I will not tell you unless you do me a favor in return. ^ ^ For a long time, we have been investigating the ritual, so that we are not dependent on the Mountain Priests. We've come quite far, but we don't have the crucial magic word. We dare not show ourselves in the Miners' guild, since we have already tried to spy on their ritual - in vain, unfortunately. They have caught us several times. ^ ^ If you find out the magic word and tell it to me, I will give you the knowledge you need. I swear it to you, on my honor."
"Do you know the magic word?"
"Then please get it. I know you can do it, because they still trust you. I will give you the information you need if you do us equipment makers this favor."
"What is it?"
"I don't believe this is the mighty password of the ritual."

"Kind Mother of the Earth - that's it. I should have been able to get that myself. Well, a promise is a promise. ^ ^ First, I thank you for your help. And, then I ask that one of you come closer so I can hand you the scroll and explain it."

{LEAD}{NAME} declares himself ready and goes to Kossotto. He receives a scroll and an extensive explanation. The others all listen carefully; but, except for {LEAD}{NAME} no-one appears to understand it completely. After some time, Kossotto finishes and somehow {LEAD}{NAME} makes a weary impression. In any case, an important ingredient for creating the seed has been found!
"I wish you good luck!"
"I can do nothing more for you now."
"It says: 'Kind Earth, do not harm me.'"
"It says: 'Umajo Danu'."
"You cannot take the scroll with you because you do not have room!"
An empty barrel.
-free-
-free-
"What are you looking for here? You can look around in the guild, but not here. Please leave the tunnel immediately."
"I'm sorry; I have to run."

"You again! You should really take this more seriously. When we are carrying out our ritual, there must be absolutely no disturbances. No-one is allowed here apart from the miners. Especially not strangers!"
"Pardon me, I will leave immediately."
"We will drive you right out of the city if you are spying on us!!!"
"Please excuse me, I'm still somewhat disoriented. But now I will leave you in peace and return to the guild house."
"I checked to see if anyone was following me. I'm sure we're alone now and can begin the ceremony."
"I ask for absolute quiet and concentration..."

After some time, the Mountain Priest throws up his arms and speaks strangely. The other two stare with great concentration into the flames of the fire. The priest extends both of his arms and glances upward. Finally, he slowly lowers his head and glances at the tips of his toes as he shouts: {CNTR} "Umajo Danu"
At first, it is quiet. The ceremony appears to be over and {LEAD}{NAME} decides to leave quickly before the miners notice him.
A hole leading down into the void...
You can climb up here.
The tunnel appears to be deeper here, but it is filled with water.
The giant cave glitters with countless remarkable crystals. The jewels are all unpolished, but their extraordinary size still make them very valuable.
"Watch out! There is a large hole in the ground right in front of us. We should only try to go down with a rope. Who knows if we'll be able to get out otherwise! Does anyone have a rope?"
Everyone looks through their backpacks and, finally, a rope is found.
Everyone look through their backpacks, but nobody has a rope.
"I think it's really too dangerous without a rope! We better not go down there."
"Good, it shouldn't be too risky with a rope."
-free-
This barrel is broken and probably unusable.
Snacks and cold meals are prepared here.
The group has just entered "The Open Path Inn." It is stuffy and warm in the tavern. The lively chatter of the numerous guests makes normal conversation almost impossible.
{CNTR} On the shield it says: {INK 006} Announcement.
{CNTR} On the shield it says: {INK 006} City Park Hotel: Overnight Stay Without Bathroom Privileges.
This door has a delicate lock, and serves as a passage between the tavern and the boarding house. However, since both buildings can be reached from the street, there is no need to open the door.
Tom is already caught up in the hustle and bustle...
"I believe the bar is inside."
"I don't like it when strangers talk to me. I won't join your religion sect and I won't buy any documents from you. Please do not disturb me any longer."
"Please give me a little money. Do you have any spare change for me?"
{LEAD}{NAME} gives the beggar 0.8 gold coins. ^ ^ "Thank you very much!"

{LEAD}{NAME} gives the beggar 0.8 gold coins. ^ ^ "Oh, that's really generous. As thanks, I'd like to tell you a little secret. The host keeps all of his money in the kitchen under a towel on the shelf! Remember, you didn't hear it from me."
"It's a shame."
"I advise you to take torches and a rope with you when you visit any of the caves in the great mountains. I got lost there once."

"Bah-What kind of conceited characters are you? You probably think you can impress me, huh? Well, you're wrong. I only let myself be impressed by extraordinary people-like Khunag, when he shows me one of his spectacular magic tricks. Have you met him yet? A funny guy. I think he's a rebellious Druid of the Kenget Kamulos, but it's hard to figure him out. He lives with Kariah."

"Have you been in our guest house? Travelers of both sexes like to visit it. Perhaps you've already met Kariah, she works there. She's always very friendly and talkative, but sometimes this causes problems. You can imagine that some customers don't appreciate it very much."
"How time passes-When I was as young as you are, I was able to enjoy life in an entirely different way. Old age does have its advantages, but you haven't learned that yet."
"I have to go eat now. Just let me through. Hmm, you're not from here, right? More and more strangers are wandering around here. But don't take it personally: it just strikes me as odd."

"I am Gato Mork, Keeper of the Holy Law, and I order you to spend 1000 gold coins to a good purpose-or I will rip your hide with my knife, ha ha. Seriously, right now I'm reading a book about the famous Gato Mork, who supports the poor and keeps an eye on the rich. He always used his life for justice. He was a great man."

(coughs) "I can hardly stand it in here. The air is just horrible! It stinks, it's hot, and it's so loud that you have to shout in order to be heard. If my boyfriend didn't always drag me into places like this, it would be so much better for my lungs. But he likes to go to bars like this, and I simply love him."
"Would you like a room for the night?"
Suddenly, an old acquaintance from Jirinaar stands in front of {LEAD}{NAME}. It is Frill, the historian of the council, who helped uncover the murder plot with his knowledge about Bradir's dagger.
"Dsarii-ma! I am so glad I finally found you!"
"Dsarii-ma, Frill! What a surprise to see you again! Why are you looking for us?"
"I would like you to come with me to a place where some people are interested in talking with you. I cannot say more until we are there."
"It sounds very secretive, honorable Frill. But we'll be glad to do it if this will help us get closer to our goal."
"Oh, I can guarantee it!"

"But first, we must try to mediate in the conflict that is about to occur between the Iskai from Srimalinar and a Celtic village. You should know that Mellthas and I have a special interest in friendly coexistence of humans and Iskai." {INK 001} Sira elaborates on how she and Mellthas have become closer, and about the threatening confrontation between the Celts and Iskai.

"I completely and entirely agree with you. You must try to prevent the worst! The last thing we need is a war between our races. I will wait here at the Inn until you have tried your best. Good luck!"
"Promise me something and then give nothing, that's just what I want!"
90 gold pieces are hidden here. Should Tom and the others become thieves?
"You must talk to Kariah from time to time. Because of her profession, she has lots of crazy stories to tell. You can generally find her in her home."
-free-
"As you can see, I am busy cooking. Although I'd like to, I just cannot feed all of you. There just isn't enough food for so many mouths."

"The hunting season is open. So, mostly, I'm out hunting animals the entire day. It's quite tiresome, since I get animals not only for our family, but also for the stores. Just imagine, I can often I lie in the bushes for hours waiting an opportunity. When I have made a profitable catch I have to drag the heavy beast back to the city. After such a hard day, I'm so tired I can really sleep well."

"Hopefully, I don't have to go get sugo out of the cellar again soon. There are loathsome flying beasts there. Naturally, I'll deal with them if I have to, but I'm really afraid of them. I would feel much safer with you."
"Look, this is my new dress that my Mommy sewed for me. Do you like it? I can only wear it when we have visitors."
-free-
-free-
"Have you ever been in our beautiful council house? It is definitely worth a visit. On the one hand, it is a magnificent historical building. On the other hand, many important people gather there."

"I haven't felt right for a while. If it continues, I will have to go see Ramina. She is our healer. She will be able to help you too, if you need it. I think I'll take a little rest. Sitting down a lot seems to help. Don't you think so? Tomorrow morning, I'll sit over there. For now, I will sit here. At dark, I'll sit over there again. Before long, it will be time to go to sleep again."
"I just don't get it. All my Daddy does is sit around all day and complain. Hopefully, he'll be better soon."

"Skeima Din, I am Rukko. I live here. Do you like the house? I think it is just beautiful. But I can't go into any other houses, since it upsets the owners. And if I upset them, they'll all be mad at me. I don't want that."
"I have to make the beds. If I can do it with no wrinkles today, I'll get a piece of sweet cake. So, please don't touch anything. Mommy is awfully picky."
-free-
"You look different from most of the people who come to see Mommy."
"Do you always make such funny noises when you are with my Mommy? Grownups sure are funny."

"Have you talked with Uncle Khunag? He's not always here, but when he is, there sure is a creepy feeling in the house. He is always nice to me, but, sometimes I'm scared of him. Uncle Khunag can do some pretty weird things. One time, I watched him while he hovered a cup over the table. But, when I asked him about it, he pretended it never happened."
"I only work here. I cook for the children and keep the house clean. Most certainly, I'm not the right person for you to talk to. If you have questions, please speak to Madam Kariah."
-free-
The barrel is empty and relatively light. The group can push it.
Nothing is written on these signs.
{INK 006}{CNTR} Council House of Beloveno.
This is a door.
The door is locked. Obviously it is not necessary for you to open this door.
"Skeima Din. If you come with friendly intentions, you are welcome to visit the council house."

"Hopefully, you will be able to find your way around. The council house is a very large building; you can easily get lost in the many corridors, halls, and conference rooms. Remember that the exit and receiving hall are in the north. In the middle buildings are the conference rooms and corridors which lead to the holy room. In the south building, there is the great Hall. And, behind that, the conference room of the council. Naturally, I mean the Council of the Just. I'll be glad to help you again later and will repeat everything again if you want."
"Don't you think more suitable clothing would be better for your visit to the Council of the Just? These are sacred halls and we like strangers to respect our customs."
"Skeima Din. I find it wonderful that people can relax here after stressful meetings. You can't find that everywhere."
"Skeima Din. I'm one of the new council members here. You are Tom and his friends, correct? Pleased to meet you."
"Skeima Din. I'm replacing Riko, the old council member."
"Shouldn't we warn Herras? Kariah's instructions specifically mentioned that. And if not, then it is better that we warn her too much rather than not enough."
-free-
"Don't mind the skulls hanging from our walls. They're not very modern, but they are valuable inheritances from our ancestors. People around here hang on to traditions."

"Skeima Din. What are you looking at? Ah, well, 'Skeima Din' is a common greeting for us. In your language it means approximately: 'What a beautiful day it is.' It would be nice if you also used the greeting. As you see, we live in modest circumstances. After all, what do gold and a kingdom mean; it is more important to lead a contented life."
"Mommy and Daddy are home. I have no money and cannot sign. You have to speak to them yourselves."
"What good is the wisdom of old age if no one appreciates it? Young people just don't respect traditions."
"Would you like to hear a song? I learned it yesterday, but I keep forgetting the words. But when I'm big, I will make lots of music."
-free-
{INK 006}{CNTR} Brodd's Food: Open From 8 a.m. to 8 p.m.
"Huh? Something about you reminds me of Khunag. I just can't figure out what. There are magicians among you, correct? I sense their presence."
"Sometimes they give me something to eat. I just have to wait long enough."
"Well, travelers, are you hungry? The meat here is very good. Just try it!"
"I'm starving! I hope you don't mind my ordering before you?"
-free-
The sales and storage area lie behind this door. The door is locked and the trader will not give the key to strangers. Fortunately, there are legal ways to get what you need.
{CNTR} The sign says: {INK 006} Shields, helmets, and armor. The very best quality.
"Please leave me alone!"

"Have you talked to Khunag? He is a rebellious magician, and I sense others like him among you. Khunag is known throughout the city for his strong and stubborn character. He lives with Kariah. You can find him there."
"What do you mean? Do I like the leather cap or a metal helmet better? Unfortunately, it is also a question of the price..."
"Arm yourself well if you want to travel far."
-free-
{CNTR}{INK 006} Best Cutting, Piercing, and Shooting Weapons: Open From 8 a.m. to 10 p.m.
"Skeima Din strangers, you've made a good choice with this store. The weapons are of better quality than those you can buy in the general store."
"Some of the clothing you're wearing is really strange..."
"I simply don't feel safe without weapons. Naturally, you have to stay up to date. Therefore, I buy new weapons often."
"I watch the great stuff people buy here!"
-free-
{CNTR}{INK 006} Mixed Goods: Open from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m.
"There has been a death in my family. I'm really not in the mood for chatting. Please excuse me."
"I believe I was here before you. Please be so kind and step behind me."
"I hope your intentions are friendly. There's already enough people that we have to watch out for."
-free-
{CNTR} On the shield it says: {INK 006} Healer Ramina.
"Can't you see that I'm busy? Get out of here!"
"I've got clusters. It's a horrible disease. You better stay away from me, or you'll get it. You feel weak, sick, and get pimples on your legs. It takes a long time to recover from it."
"Skeima Din. I had clusters, but I'm better now. Thanks to Ramina's good care I can leave the infirmary soon."
"What do you want? I don't feel well. Please leave me alone..."
-free-
"What do you want here? If you want to travel to Beloveno, go south. If you want to go to Srimalinar, go north."

"Have you spoken to Kontos already? He's the mighty leader in our village. He's very intelligent! ^ ^ There is a large room in our mighty leader's cellar where we regularly hold meetings. Kontos also experiments with fire magic there, he is an outstanding magician. However, his research areas are secret."

"Skeima Din, ^ ^ I can offer you a fair share of gold if you have something to sell. That's how I make my living. I buy things from people and resell them. You can make a good living that way. Fairly good, anyway-I'm not poor..."
"You better not do anything to me, or I'll call my big brother!"
"Skeima Din, ^ ^ Have you already seen Kontos, our great leader? He can solve all of your problems, if he has time."

"Do you want to know the latest? It has now been proven that the Iskai are experimenting with black magic in the Shrine of Srimalinar!. It has been suspected for a long time, but now we know for sure. The Iskai are trying to achieve world dominance, the beasts! ^ ^ They have been secretly experimenting with powerful magic weapons for a long time. Those horrible creatures that keep showing up around the shrine prove that a lot of black magic is being used and practiced there. Kontos is right! Our only chance is to fight them and prevent them from doing something worse! The people of Beloveno don't believe us, but if we wait for them it will be too late. That's why we will go ahead and do what must be done! ^ ^ And if you don't believe me, just visit the Iskai once and you'll be convinced, I guarantee it! They won't let you into their ominous shrine because then everyone would see what is going on in there. They try to fool everyone by pretending there's a taboo, but we won't fall for it!"

"The moment has come. We are now going to put an end to the Iskai magic and their supposed shrine. At the same time, we will also handle the problem with the creatures the Iskai are constantly creating. If we wait any longer, it'll be way too late. You should support our plan and fight with us on Kontos' side and against the evil Iskai. We're going to the shrine now. We must besiege the Iskai and take action against their evil plan. Come and help us!"
"Do you have something to sell?"
-free-
"If you want to talk to the people around here, go to the tavern. That's the meeting place in our village. Also, Kontos lives there, in the cellars under the hut."
"Mellthas! ^ ^ MELLTHAS! It's great of you to visit me! What brings you here?"
Mellthas' face shows joy as he eagerly begins to write on his note paper.
"Have you brought your friends with you? That's wonderful, you're all welcome in my home."
"Skeima Din. Are you Mellthas' friends? ^ ^ That's wonderful. He's told me about you. When you see Mellthas, please send him my best and tell him I hope he is well."
"We will do that when we see him again."
"Thank you. In any case, you're welcome here."

"I'm actually very happy that you're visiting me. But, I'm in a hurry at the moment. Kontos is making his speech soon and I must attend. But, please, come by another time. Then I'll be glad to tell you more about myself and our village."

"It's great of you to drop in. Of course, I'm not in the best of moods at the present time. Kontos' last speech has really made me think. It's not that I doubt his intelligence, but sometimes he's just too radical for me."

"The mood here is highly explosive right now. Kontos intends to occupy the shrine of Srimalinar. But er... you didn't hear that from me. We're all behind Kontos, but sometimes I'm not sure if his decisions are correct. Most people are convinced of it, however, unfortunately, I'm not. I don't know anything about the strange creatures and that shrine has been there as long as I've been alive. Why should it suddenly be dangerous? ^ ^ The whole thing will probably just blow over. In any case, most of us are standing behind our leader. I don't know, perhaps my doubts are unjustified."

"I don't know if you realized it or not, but most people in our village already left for the shrine of Srimalinar. We have decided to occupy it and to destroy the evil within it. Kontos says that the Iskai are experimenting with black magic there. ^ ^ I will soon go and stand beside my brothers."
"It's great of you to drop in again. Thanks for everything you've done for us."
"I would do anything for Kontos! Even if I have to risk my life. Then, at least I will know why."
"Don't think that we're all unfriendly. However, strangers must prove themselves here before they gain our respect."
"Skeima Din. My name is Kleronna. I'm almost as old as my brother now. Although Mommy says that I can't catch up with him. But I can!"

At a distance, two people are talking and {LEAD}{NAME} manages to catch a few scraps of the conversation: ^ ^ "...it's been said that Herras has gone to Beloveno... probably from his own rows... very tragic situation..." ^ ^ Unfortunately, because of the noise they can't hear anything more... When the Mahinos notice that the companions are listening to their conversation, they immediately change the subject.
"I have to tell you something important!"
-free-
{CNTR} I can only see you by invitation. ^ Go see Nodd, ^ signed Kontos.
"The world is beauuuutiful, tralalala."
"I guess you don't know that Otikro comes by here every morning. He is an outstanding battle trainer."
"The last time a visitor came to our village, a horrible disease broke out which killed two members of our tribe. Hopefully you aren't carrying any bad diseases like that with you."
"You cannot buy things here like in Beloveno. We all know each other and trade for the things we need. Therefore, we need no stores."
"Skeima Din, ^ ^ I teach here every day between 8 and 9. I don't believe I've introduced myself yet: my name is Garadd. I'm the best critical hit teacher you will find around here."
"Siobhan! I almost didn't recognize you after all of these years. You've become a real woman! I'm very happy that you're visiting me again."
"Would you like to use my services?"
"Are you interested in practicing close combat?"
"How are your capabilities when it comes to long distance combat? Would you like me to train you?"

{INK 006}{CNTR} Best Cutting, Piercing, and Throwing Weapons! Good Prices!
"Please don't push. We will all be served."
"I greet my brothers and sisters among you."

"I have just returned from a journey to the east. I met a small group of Kenget Kamulos there, and they used their magic against me immediately! I'll only ride well armed now. Normally, this is a safe area and this type of thing is highly unusual. Kenget Kamulos are to be treated with caution, they don't like it when you enter their territory."
"Skeima Din. I am a member of the Magicians' guild. Just come by if you're interested in magic."
"What would you like to know? This is the largest shop in Srimalinar. If you're looking for a wider range of goods, you have to go to Beloveno."
Someone behind the counter shouts that Tom and his companions have to leave the shop immediately.
empty
The living areas of the house lie behind this door. The door is tightly locked and latched. All services of the Magicians' guild are offered in this room and not in the private quarters.

"Welcome to the Magicians' guild. Hopefully, you don't dismiss magic capabilities as superstition and craziness, because if you do you're definitely in the wrong place. However, if you believe in supernatural capabilities and are looking for people with whom you can talk about it, or if you would like to be trained, you'll feel right at home. Even if you have other problems with magic or only want to exchange stories, then just sit down and we can talk."
"Go to Jikraii if you want to learn new magic spells. She is the leader of our guild and by far the best teacher. However, Jikraii is not always available. If you don't run into her, go back later."
"Look, I've learned a magic spell which changes my chest jewel to a blue color. What, you don't believe me? OK, it already was blue, but not as dark."
"Jikraii has gone to the shrine to support our warriors with magic. If I am not mistaken, you have something to do with that."
empty

"Unfortunately, I don't have much time for you. There is still a lot of work to do. My sons are harvesting fruit from the plantations in front of the city. I'm sure you've seen our plentiful gardens there. I have to process all of the fruit when they return. So I have to go and prepare the containers now."
"Do you like our house? It is very spacious. Yes, we also have room for guests. If you would like, you can stay here a little while. However, I'm sure you have other things to do."
"You know, a bath couldn't hurt you. You have, to put it mildly, a rather strong odor about you."
"If you run into Edjirr in the tavern, say hello to him from Drirra. Tell him he should come home soon. He does still have a family."
"Oh! You frightened me."
"I'm recovering from the harvest shift-I have to be in good shape for the next time."
"Skeima Din. My name is Errid and I'm the fastest runner in all Srimalinar. I'll be glad to challenge anyone who doesn't believe me to a race."

Mellthas gesticulates to indicate that he has something important to tell. Then he writes eagerly on his piece of paper: ^ ^ "We should visit my friend Darios in Kounos. Perhaps he'll bring us a little closer to the truth."
empty
"The wall! The wall!! Oh dear, the wall is turning. I believe I have drank too much."

"Skeima Din, do you see anything you would like to buy? I am a peddler and I am looking for interesting things. I pay good prices since my supply is very small right now. Just show me if you have something interesting you'd like to sell."
"Have you already been to Jikraii? She is the leader of the Magicians' guild. I am sure a visit there would be good for you."
"Harvest work is exhausting. Only a relaxing, extended visit to the tavern helps. Especially the extended part, ha ha."

"If you're looking for someone to talk to, then go see Edjirr. He's the host here and knows just about everything that happens in Srimalinar and the surrounding areas. Edjirr also knows a lot of people in Beloveno and Kounos. And everyone in Srimalinar knows Edjirr. He'll love to talk to you."

"If you don't know your way around the place, I'll be glad to help you. Travel to the north in order to go past Kounos and the mountains to Beloveno. Travel to the east if you want to get acquainted with the Kenget Kamulos. And stay away from our sanctuary since there is a taboo which forbids strangers to go there. We make no exceptions and will make very sure that the taboo is maintained."
"Skeima Din, please leave me alone now."

"Skeima Din, I'm Jirra. I'm pleased to meet you. Have you brought any news from Beloveno? You did come from Beloveno, right? Of course, I'm very interested in politics and would very much like to be informed if something important is going on. And it changes a lot more than people think. Hasn't it also struck you how often people change their opinions? Just check it out. Talk with some people about something, and then talk to them a little later about the same thing. I'll bet you'll hear something different. Aside from that, if you're new here, I can give you a couple of tips for getting along and respecting our society and culture. For example, it is important that you do not enter the famous sanctuary of Srimalinar. There is a taboo that forbids strangers from visiting this site. We consider it to be a great violation of our religion if anyone breaks the taboo. This is a thinking and praying place which we have used for many generations. For a stranger to enter, it means ill-repute for all of us. Therefore, we ask that you please respect the taboo and stay away from this place."

"Skeima Din, Jirra is my name. I believe we've already met. Didn't I already tell you about our sanctuary? There is a taboo that forbids strangers from visiting it. We consider it to be a great violation of our religion if anyone goes against the taboo. We have meditated and prayed there for many generations. For a stranger to enter means would be a sacrilege. Therefore, please respect the taboo and stay away from this place. Now, I know people are spreading rumors about our sanctuary, but all are unfounded. They say it is a magic workshop in which we practice black, evil magic. This is just as nonsensical as those legends about the horrible creatures who are supposed to come out of our sanctuary. Only these creatures really do exist, and unfortunately I just don't know where they come from. But they definitely don't come out of our shrine. There is almost always someone from our village there and no one has ever seen one of the creatures enter our sanctuary. I hope you haven't been influenced by this nonsense like the Celtic village of Kounos. Kontos has been spreading these rumors there. I really don't know why he is doing it, but hopefully I can find out and put an end to this nonsense. If you know anything about this, maybe you could tell me about it. Then, I will be glad to give you further information. I will see you when you come back. But, be sure to talk to all the important people in Kounos and Beloveno so you can find out more!"

"You still dare to show yourself here? After everything that has happened? I don't understand you. The rumors and the poor arguments of the Celts are ridiculous. This place is no more dangerous than any other cave in this area. And you want to go in and violate our taboo? That would be a direct attack against our people. We can only react against it with anger and incomprehension. I don't know what you are thinking, but I just can't believe what you are doing. There will be a war, whether or not we understand your motives. In any case, we have to defend ourselves, and we will do that. Most of our warriors have already marched off to provide resistance. Now only a miracle can prevent the worst."
{CNTR}HERE ^ New Sugo.
empty
Behind this door rests an eternal consciousness. He should be granted his rest.

When Tom and his companions enter the holy cellar, they are quite surprised at first. Each of them had imagined this place to be quite different: gloomy, cold, oppressive. No one expected what was here. This cellar looks almost like someone's home. It's quite comfortable and offers everything you need to live. Only the gathering hall and the remarkable doors make it different. There is a special feeling to this place. {LEAD}{NAME} even thinks {HE } hears the soft sound of bells. In any case, {HE } does not want to disturb the eternal peace of the Iskai souls here.
"Kontos is not here. I've searched everywhere, I don't know where he is."

"Here we are in Beloveno, my friends! I would propose that first we look around the city. Maybe we'll learn about the Toronto. Anyhow, we have to try to make progress, we have a lot to accomplish in this large city."
A fountain.
"Skeima Din, are you looking for something in particular?"

With careful descriptions, Tom and his companions are trying to find out if the residents of the town know something about the Toronto landing. But it doesn't look good: Zimos hasn't seen or heard anything about it. If he's telling the truth, then the Toronto landing place must be far away. Then, there is the question of where to look. Maybe they can get some reliable transportation if they get to know some people better. Therefore, it is certainly worthwhile to get to know Beloveno and its immediate surroundings thoroughly.

"If you would like to get something, then talk with the people. That's the only way you'll find out anything here. If you can't talk, you'll get nowhere around here. Talk to the people often! It pays to be persistent. Just recently, I talked my neighbor out of his little decorative fountain. He hasn't needed it for years, but I had to ask him five times until he finally gave in. Some people are simply pigheaded. Most people here are that way. And, some change their minds as the political situation changes. Simply stay with the people and talk to them."
"Unfortunately, I don't have time for a lengthy conversion. But when you get a chance to talk to someone ask them about the mountain pass, Kounos, and Srimalinar."
"When you come out of the city, defend yourself against the krondirs. They are aggressive stalkers."

"Please do not go through our grain fields while you are looking around. A quarter of the last harvest was destroyed because some people had nothing better to do than take shortcuts through our fields."

"Sometimes I stand at the harbor for hours and listen to the sound of the waves. Natural forces always continue to impress me. Isn't it wonderful to breathe the fresh, salt air and to feel the spray on your face?"
"What are you doing around here? People are getting funnier and funnier..."
"You cannot and need not understand everything."
"Skeima Din. If you would like to get to know people, then visit the tavern. You can also rent a room for the night."
"If you are new to the city, you should first report to the council house!"
{CNTR}{INK 006} Closed. Open from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m.

Perhaps the residents of Srimalinar know something about the Toronto landing. {LEAD}{NAME} speaks to the Iskai about it.

"I am sure I would know if something that big landed here or had been discovered. The area is fairly hilly. If this thing is actually as big as you say it is, then it couldn't have withstood the landing undamaged. There aren't any large, level clearings here. Also, Maini is heavily populated. Humans, Druids, and Iskai live here, and I don't believe that something like that would have gone unnoticed."

"Would you like to know something about Srimalinar? The city is very old. Originally we all come from Nakiridaani. Our ancestors left in search of a new place to settle. After all, Nakiridaani is not that big. But there is a lot of room here, and the humans respect us. We're very thankful to them. We all regularly pray in our holy thinking place. This is also where our deceased ancestors find eternal rest. All who were fair and good in their lives achieve the eternal consciousness there. Please be aware, though, that there is a taboo which forbids strangers from visiting this place. We consider it to be a profound desecration of our religion if the taboo is broken."

"Do you know your way around Srimalinar? We're actually only a small settlement, even though the village has a large surface area. But you will see that we're not really that big. There are only a few shops where you can buy things. But you must visit the inn! It is the most important meeting place in Srimalinar. Maybe you'd like to see some of the residences. Naturally, the guild of Magicians would be interesting for you; we're famous for our magic scholars and their extraordinary capabilities."
"Daddy has to harvest the fields in front of the city. In the meantime, I just play here. But while everybody is harvesting, it's really boring. Nobody's here."

"Last night, a kritah ran across my path again. I hate those creatures. They are harmless, but they steal shiny objects. They live in the rock caves on the edge of the mountain. Everyone says they're not dangerous, but in general, it is a bad omen to meet one of these animals. And, now, I've seen them again. What is going to happen? I'm already imagining the worst!"

"That crazy dream again - it must be the tenth time. What does it mean? ^ ^ I can't remember ever having dreamed in color before ... ^ ^ Well, I'll take a little walk and shake it off. Hopefully they'll soon announce when I have to launch the shuttle for our exploratory flight."
"Hi, big guy! Did you get enough sleep?"
"Christine! It's sure good to see you, honey! ^ I feel awful. You were right last night, I should have stayed with you. I had that crazy dream again. It's getting... clearer... every time."
"It's crazy all right. You're not usually affected like this. It must have something to do with the over-c jump. Stay with me tonight and I will drive away those awful nightmares!"

"The dream began before the jump and it's not really that scary. It's just so intense. ^ ^ Never mind, what's the use. I'll just walk around for a while longer. Maybe I'll run into Captain Brandt and find out when I have to launch with Snoopy."
"Snoopy? Haven't you ...? Boy, you must have slept sound. You could hear the explosion through the entire section!"
"Explosion? Get to the point! What are you talking about, Chris? What happened to Snoopy?"
"He took control of the over-c COM unit during the jump. It overloaded and pretty much exploded. They say bits of him were all over the place."
"Oh man... that's awful! Boy, it sure makes you stop and think! That makes Hofstedt the only government official on board."
"Yeah, and I've heard you are going to make the exploratory flight with Hofstedt now instead of Snoopy."

"Well, if that isn't a great start to my day. But, I guess, things aren't so bad... Hofstedt is O.K. and the accident really doesn't change anything in my flight plan. I'll have to talk to Joe about it."
"Your buddy is assigned to the Northeast section today, near the access to the communications room. ^ ^ Well, I have to get going now - I still have a lot of work to do. See you later, sweetie."
"Bye, Christine."
This door is locked.
"Excuse me, Driscoll! Don't get mad, but I would like some privacy. Please stay outside."
"There is nothing to see here. Please move along."
{INK 001} This is Rainer Hofstedt - physicist, xenobiologist, and government inspector. He seems excited to see you.
"Driscoll, hello! I am so pleased I ran into you! Have you heard about Inspector Beegle's unfortunate demise?"
"Hello, Hofstedt. Yes my girlfriend just told me about it. It's really too bad-it must have been a horrible sight!"

"That stubborn British blockhead! He was no engineer, but he should have known the risks involved in operating the COM unit during the over-c jump. We're still a long way from completely understanding this whole beyond-light-speed technology. The poor devil!"
"That makes you the only government official on board now, right?"

"Yes, I'm the only snoop left-please don't remind me. Anyway, I spoke with Captain Brandt. He still intends to carry out the exploratory flight-and with humble me instead of Beegle. Well, Driscoll, it looks like you've got a new passenger now."
"I don't want to seem heartless, but it's all the same to the shuttle-it needs two people. As far as I am concerned, the flight can take place as planned."
"Yes, I agree. And, I must confess I am very excited about the flight. The take-off should be within the next couple of days. We must wait for the Captain's announcement."
"Well, I guess that is all for now. I'm sure we'll see each other before then. See you later, Hofstedt"
"Yes, till then, Driscoll."
"Hello, Driscoll. Good luck with your flight."
{INK 001} The security guard casts a suspicious glance at Tom. He doesn't answer.
"Hello, Driscoll! I heard you have a new passenger since they scraped the inspector off the wall. ^ Anyway, I'm crossing my fingers for your flight."
"Hi, Tom. Sorry, I'm in a bit of a rush. I'm really booked up right now! I'll catch you later."
"Hello, Tom. I'd like to see inside the COM room, you know, where Snoopy got it. Too bad there's a security guard at the door."

In this, the Vatican reinforced its position against birth control and the question of abortion. According to the encyclical, the development and protection of the unborn will take precedence over 'individual special interests' -now, and in the future says the paper. The pope described contraception as a 'damnable attack against the biological sovereign rights of God. Even a constantly increasing overpopulation cannot be reason enough to retreat from this principle of civilization.'"

{TECF} NEWSFLASH (text mode). ^ ^ {LEFT} "Brussels-The Secretary of the Interior of the United States of Europe, John McDermott, called the latest encyclical of the Vatican a 'further denial of all realities of this world, characteristic of this sect.' Particularly shocking is the high number of juveniles who easily fall victim to such methods. McDermott announced an increased monitoring of the Vatican by European agents. In particular, he would like to keep the enormously increased armaments industry of the Vatican under observation. {TECF} NEWSFLASH (text mode) . ^ ^ {LEFT} "Stuttgart-Tokyo-A spokesman of the DDT corporation came forward for the first time to react to rumors that a factory ship, the 'Toronto', of the corporation has gone missing during a mission in space. From this, it is assumed that the ship's systems are operating normally and in a few years the first freight ships from the Toronto will arrive on Earth. Therefore, a rescue mission is unnecessary and also would take too long since a trip to this planet would take at least three years. {TECF} NEWSFLASH (text mode). ^ ^ {LEFT} "Strasbourg-A resolution, regarding penalties for praying with minors, was rejected at the annual meeting of European Social Studies teachers today. Rather, they have to be identified and treated as having a sickness."

{TECF} NEWSFLASH (text mode). ^ ^ {LEFT} "Geneva-The Foreign Ministers of the European, American, and Asiatic Communities, met today in their semiannual conference concerning further peaceful collaboration (SPSC). However, the Asiatic emperor's threat to blow up the jointly planned tunnel project under the Bering Sea was not the subject of the conference. A final declaration will not appear until tomorrow evening."

{TECF} NEWSFLASH (text mode). ^ ^ {LEFT} "The Chinese scientist Huo Wong Gang won this year's Gates Prize for their pioneering research in plasma physics. Huo Wong Gang was the first Chinese to win the prize endowed with 470 million credits. The Gates prize has been awarded to outstanding scientists and business people for 154 years."
{TECF} NEWSFLASH (text mode). ^ ^ {LEFT} "A sports report. Golf. In the National Cup game between Iraq and the USA, the score stands 2:1 for the favored Americans after 3 of 5 rounds."

{TECF} NEWSFLASH (text mode). ^ ^ {LEFT} "An earthquake warning- There will be no expected quakes or tremors tomorrow, September 9, 2230, in the San Andreas fault area. Small tremors, which certainly should not exceed a value of 3.5 on the open-ended Richter scale, may appear only in the Los Angeles area. The Japanese coastal regions are also behaving peacefully with no quakes expected there. However, the northern Mediterranean west of Athens will see some unrest. The measurement of the international earthquake monitors indicate a quake with a strength of around 5, which of course will have minimal effects on the Greek provincial capital."

{TECF} NEWSFLASH (text mode). ^ ^ {LEFT} "It was not possible to settle the salary conflict between the space pilot's union and the supranational space centers today. While a company spokesman for the employers' side categorically denies any "Utopian" share, the opposite side calculates that this year alone 400 billion profit credits would be distributed from the patents as a result of research obtained in space. "We would like to have a piece of this pie," a union spokesman said."

{TECF} NEWSFLASH (text mode). ^ ^ {LEFT} "Nuremberg-The president of the European Institute for Labor, Jagoda, presented his report for August today. The speaker of the sociological opposition in the European Parliament, Giuseppe Piscator, challenged the recklessly antisocial policy of the Union government which, he stated, permitted the supranational corporations record profits while tolerating the demise of major European cities into slums without taking any action. Piscator said literally: "It is obvious that the government has a personal interest in having American conditions prevail in Europe. The opposition will not tolerate this reversion to Thatcher capitalism without doing anything."

A console for calling up news.
A gigantic bulkhead.
"Hi, Tom! Come on in and let's have a nice, comfortable evening together."
Tom is not troubled by his dream tonight. ^ ^ Some time later, Tom leaves Christine's cabin.

{TECF}{CNTR} ENTER ACCESS CODE.
Tom climbs down to the service level.

This is the COM room! Tom looks around carefully, but no one is here. The odor of scorched electronic equipment hangs in the air.
These are the remains of the COM room. The explosion must have been devastating.
Tom is just about to turn away when he notices an object under the destroyed console. It is a weapon!
"How in the world did this gun get here? Except for security, weapons are strictly forbidden on board! ^ ^ An interesting find in any case ..."
The destroyed COM unit. There is no longer anything interesting to find.
The destroyed COM unit. There's something underneath!
Fragments of the destroyed COM unit.
The security officers' faces show concern, then anger, when they see someone walk out of the secured area!
"Stay right there, Driscoll! How did you get into that blocked-off area? ^ ^ Don't move, we are going to search you!"
Colonel Priver searches Tom.
"O.K. You can go now. But be certain that we will make note of this incident in your personal records. I can promise you that!

"A weapon! Driscoll, are you crazy? This is going to be marked in your personal records, you can count on that! ^ ^ Get out of here, you will be hearing from us! ^ ^ {INK 001} Colonel Priver confiscates the weapon!"
"You again! Are you looking for trouble, or what?"
"Stand still!" ^ ^ {INK 001} Colonel Priver searches Tom thoroughly.
This is where Tom stores his personal items.

There are some cartridges in this cabinet!
Stimdrinks. A special mixture of potent medications.
Special instruments like this can be used for picking mechanical locks!
Nourishment in the forms of concentrated bars is found here.
A defective fluorescent bulb.

{INK 001} A loudspeaker announcement: ^ ^ {INK 002} "Announcement for Pilot Driscoll. Please report for launch of the exploratory flight."
{INK 001} A loudspeaker announcement: ^ ^ {INK 002} "Last call to Pilot Driscoll. Report to the shuttle hangar immediately."
"Good. I better get going."
Tom runs quickly to the shuttle hangar, where several people are already waiting for him.
{FAT }{CNTR} A large script sequence follows now. Tom and Rainer fly off and crash on the planet!
People are already waiting for Tom in the shuttle hangar. He runs to the prepared shuttle quickly.
This bulkhead leads to the cabins of the management personnel and the captain. Access is not possible for other crew members.
This goes into the infirmary and security personnel's accommodation section of the Toronto. Regular crew members have no access.
"Ah, finally. I must remember everything I want to take on my flight."
Yep.
This is the shuttle hangar.
The bulkhead to the command bridge. Only a few crew members have access here. Tom is not one of them.

Two security guards stand in front of the entrance to the COM room. This is where the ship's communication units are installed.

Report for launching the shuttle? {BLOK000} Yes, launch. {BLOK001}No, wait.
